She is ready now to open her business but does not have enough startup capital.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabric to get started.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics to start a new business

loans.name: Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Amos,who is in his late 30s, is married, with two girls who are in school. Since 2002, he has had a genge (fruits and vegetables) business. He indicated that it is a good business due to more customers. He works from 6am to 2pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more genge (fruits and vegetables) stocks, buy a plot of land where he expects to build a house, pay school fees and household expenses, and he has successfully paid back all his loans. 

Amos will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to reach his increased clients' demand. His dream is to one day be able to build a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group 'Jamaica,' which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Kisanga K Group

texts.en:
JOHN, who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Four of the children are in school while the remaining one is already married with one child. For a period of two years now, JOHN has been running two businesses, clearing and forwarding services and Daladala (passenger buses). He is doing fine with his businesses. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a very good profit per month.

This will be his seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a plot where he has already built a house, helped open a clothes business for his wife, and has paid school fees and household expenses.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully. He will use this loan to pay for business debts as well as for school fees. His dream is to one day be able to build another expensive and better house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "KISANGA K", which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for business debts as well as school fees.

loans.name: Kanayim

texts.ru: Канаиым 48 лет. Образование у Канаиым среднее образование.  Канаиым воспитала 4 детей, младшая дочка учится в школе. сын уехал на заработки в Россию. По хозяйству Канаиым помогают муж и дочка. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и шустрая. После развала СССР семья начала занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас семья выращивает скот и занимается полеводством. Совокупный годовой доход семьи составляет около 150,000 KGS Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канаиым обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита планирует купить или построить дом для сына.
texts.en: Kanayim is 48 years old and has received a higher education.  She has raised 4 children; her youngest, a daughter, is in elementary school.  Her son is currently working in Russia.  Her husband and son help Kanayim in her work.  She is, by character, a very nice and sympathetic woman.  She is very sociable and energetic.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, the family began working in agriculture.  Now, the family raises cattle and crops.  The gross annual income for the family is around 150,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Kanayim has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to buy cattle.  She plans to buy or build a home for her son with the income from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar, 38, is a farmer with eight children from the remote region of Kabompo district, North Western Province, Zambia. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a water pump so that he may irrigate his vegetable farm.

Oscar started his business of farming vegetables for the local market in 2003. Currently he produces fresh maize, cabbage, and tomatoes. While his business is growing at a fast rate, his farm remains small and is limited by the seasons. He is also unable to expand his current crops as he is forced to fetch water with a bucket.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Oscar, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, it is rare to find equipment such as a water pump in such a remote region of the country, and transport to the capital city (two days travel) can be prohibitive. Once Oscar secures a loan, he will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, whether in the rainy season or dry season, Oscar will be able to produce and sell a range of produce throughout the year, unlike at the moment where he has a shortage of water during the dry season. The use of a pump will also mean that he can irrigate a larger portion of land in less time and not be restricted by the labor-intensive task of carrying water by hand to his field.

Oscar added that when he starts producing more products, he would like to extend his business to be able to serve markets in other nearby communities.

It is for this reason Oscar is appealing to the Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate his vegetable crops and expand his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is a 53-year-old married woman living with her 54-year-old husband and two daughters in Zestafoni district. The family has two milk cows and owns a plot of agricultural land where they grow grapes. The harvested products are sold locally at the Zestafoni markets. The family has a small monthly income. 

Nargiz is a very experienced farmer, as she has been in this business for 25 years. With the requested loan, Nargiz will be able to pay the university fees of her younger daughter. As she had a problem with covering monthly expenses, Nargiz was going to sell the cattle to give her daughter a chance to get a proper education.  

The Kiva loan will give Nargiz an opportunity to keep their family business and invest in her daughter’s future.

loans.use: to pay her youger daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús, es una mujer de 41 años de edad, quien ha laborado la gran parte de su vida debido  a la precaria situación económica de su familia. 
Laboró en diferentes negocios comerciales de su localidad, hasta que logró reunir el dinero suficiente para montar su propio negocio. Hoy cuenta con un negocio dedicado a la comercialización de refrescos y cerveza.
 Aunque su mayor sueño es poder aumentar su variedad de productos, es conciente que para ello requiere de comprar un refrigerador con mayor capacidad de almacenamiento. Pero tiene claro que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo. Por el momento recurrirá un crédito con el propósito de comprar más surtido para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.

Jesús tiene la esperanza que de esta manera sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente, y sus condiciones de vida serán mejores.
texts.en: Jesús is a 40-year-old woman who has worked for most of her life due to her family's economic situation. She worked in different businesses in her area until she saved enough money to start her own business. She runs a business selling sodas and beer. Although her dream is to be able to offer a wider variety of products, she is conscious that she needs to buy a bigger refrigerator to store her products. However, she understands that this is a medium-term goal. Right now, she is requesting a loan to buy more stock to satisfy consumer demand. Jesús hopes that she will be able to increase her sales considerably and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire more chickens and buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Josefa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Josefa de 64 años de edad, originaria de  San Isidro Matagalpa, pero tiene  25 años de vivir  en Managua, viuda, madre de 5 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace más de 20 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  con capital propio, la cual con esfuerzo y sin ayuda de nadie ha logrado salir adelante, con el objetivo de seguir  invirtiendo cada día mas en su pulpería, para obtener mejores   ganancias  y poder mantener estable su negocio y a sus hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad y la apoyan con lo que pueden. 
Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosa, snacks y a la misma vez comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borrador, reglas, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la mercadería que aún no tiene en existencia, espera incrementar sus ventas, para obtener mejores ingresos, dentro de sus planes futuros es ampliar el área de su negocio y al mismo tiempo mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en: Josefa is 64 years old and comes from San Isidro Matagalpa, although she has been living in Managua for 25 years. Josefa is a widow, mother of five children, and a retailer by trade. She runs a convenience store that she has owned for more than 20 years. She started working in retail using her own capital, and through her own efforts and without anyone else's help, she has managed to do well for herself. Her goal is to continue investing every day in her store to make more profits and to keep the business and her family stable. Her children are grown up now and support her with what they can. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, and school supplies such as notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, rulers, etc. She believes that the loan will help her to buy all of the merchandise that she does not have at this time and increase her sales to create more income. She would like to make her store bigger and also make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, sodas, snacks and school supplies such as notebooks, pencil cases, erasers, rulers, etc.

loans.name: Akouavi Délali

texts.fr: Akouavi Délali est une femme âgé(e) de 24ans. Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douane et n’a pas d’enfant en charge. Akouavi Délali travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux et pagnes de façon ambulante depuis 2007. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et au BENIN. Elle a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux et pagnes. Elle espère agrandir une activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et assurer une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi Délali  is a 24-year-old woman.  She is married to a customs officer and has no minor dependent.  

Since 2007, she has been reselling jewelry and "pagnes" (traditional West African fabrics), door to door.  She buys her goods at the Lomé Grand Market and also in Benin.  She has requested a third loan cycle from WAGES, for the purchase of jewelry and pagnes.  

She hopes to expand her business by opening a shop.  She would also like to provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy some "pagnes".

loans.name: Lamuel

texts.en:
Lamuel comes from the Kabale district, but lives in Ntungamo town, about 45 kilometers away from his home. He rents the place where he lives.  

Lamuel is a recovery officer in different institutions; he does this work on a temporary basis. He has come to Ugafode Microfinance for a loan of 2.000.000 UGX to buy a motorcycle. He will use this bike to get additional income by transporting people from one place to another.  

He hopes that his additional income will relieve him from renting, and enable him to take better care of his family .

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 22-year-old man living in the Akhaltsikhe district. He lives with his 18-year-old wife, his parents, brother and sister. 

The family owns a plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. They also have 40 milk cows, 16 calves, 2 bulls, 2 buffaloes and 2 horses.  They produce dairy products with the cattle. The produced and harvested products are sold locally at the Akhaltsikhe markets. 

Davit has been working as a farmer from a young age, and he has already been in this business for eight years. He requested a loan to purchase hay for his cattle. When the cattle are fed properly, they will produce more, and better, milk. This will help the family to grow their production and sales volume. 

With the profit, Davit wants to save to buy a house for him and his wife, so they can live independently of his family. Davit awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy hay for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from two years old to eight years old. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located within a slum area, and his primary customers are the local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy  is a 25 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be an understanding and warm woman . She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local area residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell. Her business goal is to run an established restaurant within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is a 27 year old single woman. She has a child who is 7 years old. She describes herself as an innovative and honest woman . She operates a retail store where she sells clothes and shoes . She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local area residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of clothes and shoes to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy additional shoes and clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a well established boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock she has available to resell, like different kinds of soap, sacks of rice, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Ms. Shakeela is a 30-year-old woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Shakeela started her business of stitching after she got divorced. She doesn’t want to become a burden on her family so she is working hard to contribute to the family income.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy more spools of thread with the packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. Then she would be able to meet with the demands of her customers without fail.  She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future. 


.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with the packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy  is a 48-year-old married man; he has five children. He describes himself to be a warm, loving, and independent man. 

Jeremy operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located at a ready market, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds for supplying his milk to customers. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cows to sell. His business goal is to run a retail shop selling milk within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 45 year old married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as an honest and ambitious man. He operates a motorcycle to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local area residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the frequent breakdown of his motorcycle. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy at least five more motorcycles within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is a 52 year old married man living in the Kharagauli district with his wife, two grown sons and retired sister. The family owns an agricultural plot of land where they grow different kinds of vegetables. They also have one milk cow and 10 pigs. Murman’s wife milks the cow and makes dairy products. The family sells the produce, dairy products and piglets in the local markets and they have a small monthly income. 

With the requested loan Murman will be able to buy building material to build a cattle shed. As he has had problems buying these materials, he was going to sell his cattle. The Kiva loan will give him an opportunity to save the cattle, build a proper shed and look after them better. After the shed is built Murman will be able to increase the number of cattle in the future and implement his plans. This will help the family to expand their business, increase their income and give them a chance to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To build a cattle shed

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 30 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 4 years. He describes himself as an honest and creative man. He operates a food stall where he sells food, snacks and tea. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local area residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. His business goal is to run a well established restaurant within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be an honest and focused woman. Evaline operates a general store where she sells items such as cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, ladies clothes etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a peri-urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy household items for resale. Her business goal is to run a well established wholesale shop within 5 years. This is Evaline's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 47-year-old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in the transport sector and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and renovate his residential house. Yusef is a responsible father who is determined to change his life and that of his children by educating them up to university, so that they can have reputable jobs. High fuel prices and mechanical break down affect his business growth, while his desire is to buy another taxi. Yusuf intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fazal Hussain

texts.en:
Mr Fazal Hussain is 50 years of age. Since 2002, he has been running a small general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He sells oil, rice, sugar, wheat, etc in his store. His wife is a 38-year-old hardworking and responsible housewife. He is the father of six children. 

This general store is the only source of income for his large family. He is going through a very hard time, and lives hand to mouth.  Presently he is facing a lot of problems in meeting family expenses. He has asked for a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of the loan, he will purchase sugar, wheat, rice, oil, tea, etc...  He wants to save for his daughter's marriage. 

He is feeling very satisfied after getting loan, because he is hopeful that with the help of the loan, he will get good profit in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, wheat, flour, tea, etc to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Karina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Gloria lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, ella cultiva pataste. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 6,000 lempiras para comprar materiales como palos, clavos y cabuya para hacer el ramal para el cultivo del pataste. Su plan es ampliar y mejorar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 32-year-old single mother with two children. She and her family live in a neighborhood in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Gloria is a farmer who has spent the past 10 years growing chayote squash. Whatever she produces is sold at the local market. She is requesting her second loan, which is in the amount of 6,000 HNL, so that she can buy materials such as wooden posts, nails, and string for making a trellis for her chayote crop.

Her plans include expanding and improving her crop.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a trellis for her chayote crop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 28-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 4 years old. She describes herself to be a hard-working woman. Cecilia operates a tailoring retail store where she sells the clothes that she makes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market  and her primary customers are local residents. Cecilia describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy material for making new clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a well-established tailoring retail store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothing material

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, a resident of Kyezitira, Rukiri village is an illiterate farmer who lives with a 7-member family in a semi-permanent house. He solely survives on coffee farming and small-scale animal rearing for his and his family's livelihood, a job he has done since childhood. Alex’s main challenge is to see all his children educated and take over his work when he retires. He has now applied for a loan of UGX.1,000,000 from Ugafode to enable him to buy manure for his coffee plantation so that he can improve his yields.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She and her husband have built their own house and ring fence parallel with her father’s fence. The house the family resides in is near to the road and, during day time, lots of passengers pass by. So, two years ago, they decided to open a grocery store and built it next to their house. 

During summertime, Otgonjargal and her husband have lots of work since they are both specialized professionals in architecture. She makes decking of boardwalk and sells it to apartment owners. 

Her elder daughter studies at a college which prepares seasoned, technical drafters. Also, the family plants vegetables on her father’s land and, in autumn, they harvest and sell their vegetables in their grocery store. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over two years, due to strong storms and floods and it needs some serious repair and expansion. So, Otgonjargal is requesting a loan of MNT 5,000,000 to purchase building materials, such as bricks, cement, boards, and metal. 

As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and spacious place. The overall advantage of repairing the house is it enables the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Otgonjargal is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair and expand her home, such as bricks, cement, boards, and metal.

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her 20s, is married. She has two girls: one goes to school, and the other one is still a baby. Since 2004, Pili has had a business that sells different kinds of clothes.  She is doing fine with the business and family as well. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fifteen loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy iron sheets, sacks of cements for house-building preparation, clothes, a TV, DVD, fridge, computer, covered school fees and home expenses, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy a plot of land and add more clothes to her shop to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to own enough money so that she can deposit some in her kids' bank accounts.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Khanga, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land and add more clothes to her shop to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37-year-old man from Kaimosi, located in Kakamega county. He is married to Josephine and is blessed with three children who are 12, 8 and 4 years of age.

For the past five years David, a small scale farmer, has operated a motorbike transportation service as his main source of income, earning KES. 10,850 each month. Now requesting his third loan with KADET LTD to buy a new motorbike to increase his business, he will use the anticipated profit to expand his enterprise. He wants to grow his business so as to own a transportation firm.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rokhaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce souriant groupe de 22 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier et elles y sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Aissata est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 garçon et une fille, tous scolarisés. Elle est  debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en blanc . 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 50,000 francs cfa elle va se procurer des lots de tasses et d'assiettes qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du quartier pour développer son activité de petit commerce.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This happy-looking group comprises 22 women who have joined the "banc villageois" since its first cycle.  They are united by good social and professional relationships.

The group's representative, Aissata, is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of two children (one boy and one girl) who both attend school.  She is standing at the far right of the photo, raising her hand, and dressed in white.

Her new loan of 50,000 CFA francs will help her to buy some sets of cups and plates which will be resold for retail in her neighborhood.  Her goal is to develop her small business.

With her profits, she will be able to take care of her children's nutritional, medical, and educational needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for retail resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy certain kinds of drinks that are now lacking from the grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 51 años de edad, practica el oficio de la carpintería desde hace 13 años. Desarrolló su potencial gracias a un pariente que le enseñó el arte de convertir la madera en maravillosos artículos decorativos y funcionales. 
Con su actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciéndoles a sus dos hijos menores de edad una buena educación. 
Desde hace cuatro años montó su propio taller y labora como independiente.  De ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche, realiza todo tipo de artículos (muebles, camas, sillones, comedores)
En la actualidad Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la  compra de materias primas y adecuación del local, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 51 years old and has worked as a carpenter for 13 years.  He developed his potential thanks to a relative who taught him the art of turning wood into marvelous items that are decorative and functional.

Through his work he has managed to provide a better life for his family, offering a good education to his two young children.  Four years ago he opened his own shop, which he runs independently.  From eight in the morning to eight at night, he makes all types of items - furniture, beds, chairs and dining room tables.

He is currently seeking a loan in order to buy raw materials and to make improvements to his shop.  His goal is to increase his sales and guarantee better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and make improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add an extension to her house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  Gina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for twenty years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima, habitante de la ciudad de Managua, casada, madre de 6 hijos de  21,18,15,11 ,3 y 1 año de edad respectivamente, de los cuales solo 4 están estudiando , ella se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y su esposo es chofer de un microbús que hacer recorrido escolar. De esta manera ambos sostienen a su familia, pues la difícil situación económica y la escases de trabajo la impulsaron a buscar otras formas de ingresos que le permitiera pagar y dar de comer a sus hijos los cuales desea que estudien y sea profesionales ya que ella ya no pudo seguir lo cual lamenta y no quiere ese futuro para sus hijos. 
Ella busco el financiamiento para comprar material de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos, pintar, mejorar los baños y también darle mantenimiento vehicular al microbús.  Dentro de sus planes futuros desea comprar un taxi para conseguir otras formas de ingresos y poder ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fátima is a married woman who lives in Managua with her six children aged 1, 3, 11, 15, 18 and 21.  Four of her children are in school.  She has a business renting out rooms, and her husband drives children to school in a minibus.  In this way they are able to support there family.  The difficult economic situation and scare opportunities for employment motivated her to seek other forms of income to enable her to feed her children and cover their expenses.  She wants them to study and become professionals, since she was not able to do this herself, and she wants a better future for them.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy construction materials to make improvements to the rooms she rents out, to paint and renovate the bathrooms, and perform maintenance on her minibus.  Among her future plans are to buy a taxi in order to pursue other forms of income and be able to save for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to the rooms she rents out, to paint and renovate the bathrooms, and perform maintenance on her minibus.

loans.name: Gabriella

texts.fr: Gabriella est une jeune dame de 30 ans. Mariée à un entrepreneur, ils ont 02 enfants en charge. L’ainé âgé de 06ans va à l’école et le dernier 01an n'est pas encore scolarisé. Gabriella est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce son activité dans une boutique et achète les marchandises au Grand Marché de Lomé. Gabriella a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sucres, du lait et des boites de conserve. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’avoir plus de profits et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gabriella, aged 30, is a young woman who is married to an entrepreneur.  She and her husband financially support two children.  The oldest is six years old and attends school, the youngest is one and does not go to school yet.

Gabriella resells general food products.  She works in a shop and stocks up at the Lomé Grand Market.

She has requested her third loan from WAGES for the purchase of sugar, milk and canned food.  She wants to reinvest in her business in order to make more profits and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be a disciplined woman. Jemima operates a restaurant where she sells chicken. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located within a vibrant business area and her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Jemima will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy chickens for cooking to sell. Her business goal is to run a poultry business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chickens for cooking to sell

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a 45-year-old woman. She describes herself to be an obedient woman. She operates a tailoring retail business where she sells dresses that she makes. Anjeline has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a vibrant business area and her primary customers are ladies and residents from the surrounding area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of business security within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric for making new clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a retail business selling fabric within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to produce clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction eguipment: pipes, buckets, electric water pumps, etc.

loans.name: Sadique

texts.en:
Mr. Sadique has been running a dairy business in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. His business is the only source of income for his family. He has four buffaloes. He sells their milk in the main market and door to door as well. He sells quality milk and all of his customers like the fresh and pure milk from his dairy farm. 

Mr. Sadique belongs to a poor family. He has to do a lot to provide for his family. He is a father of two children. His wife remains sick and he has to spend a lot for her treatment. 

Mr. Sadique is interested in purchasing one more buffalo to expand his business. Therefore he has requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 Pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. 

He dreams of providing quality education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase one buffalo to sell milk.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 43 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leticia earns a living by selling eggs and dried fish in the Philippines. Leticia requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy eggs and dried fish to sell to customers.

Leticia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Leticia would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy eggs and dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be a humble woman. Roseline operates a grocery retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a slum area and her primary customers are residents from the slum area. Roseline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate quantities of tomatoes to sell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy six crates of tomatoes to sell. Her business goal is to be the major supplier of tomatoes to the institutions within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy 6 crates of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 54-year-old hard-working woman with 4 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is transportation, alongside party decoration and rearing animals as her additional income. Like all good mothers she desires to educate her children up to University and set up sustainable income-generating activities for each one of them. Prolonged drought and disease affect her business, while her dream is to own a ranch. Rose intends to use the loan to buy a cow for rearing .

loans.use: to buy a cow for rearing

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw materials needed in shoe repair. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP to buy raw materials needed in shoe and umbrella repair. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie dreams of giving her children a good life and education and hopes to branch out. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in shoe and umbrella repair.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as sardines, snack foods, and other groceries.

Sonia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns income from E-loading and farming sugarcane.

Sonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sardines, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson is 24 years old, married and has two children. He is selling grocery items to earn a living. He has been in the business for almost a year and generates income for the sustenance of the family. He would like to keep offering more grocery items and that is why he is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles and soft drinks to sell.  

In the future, Erickson hopes to achieve more income and save funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice milling business in the Philippines.

Melba requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay the laborers' salaries for her rice milling business. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Melba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the laborers' salaries for her rice mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Philistia

texts.en: Philistia is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be a disciplined and polite woman. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 21000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her family members for household activities. Her business goal is to venture into the dairy-farming business within 5 years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to pay off a loan of KES 20,000 previously.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts for a spare parts retail business

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms. Robina is a 43-year-old woman; she has been manufacturing carpets for many years, in order to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets and is famous in her circle for providing good quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. For the improvement of her business Robina contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres to use in handmade carpets and increase her sales.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Mr. Shahid is 37 years old. He has been running a shoe shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of three children. He has requested a loan amount of 100,000 Pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount he wants to purchase a variety of shoes for his shop. 

He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family. He wishes to provide a bright future to his children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria de 40 años de edad, originaria de Managua, soltera, madre de 1 hijo de 20 años el cual está estudiando su carrera universitarias de ingeniería en sistema, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una librería de la que es propietaria hace más de 11 años. Inicio su negocio con capital propio, dinero que le dio su compañero quien era maestro de educación física, fue así que  decidió emprender su propio negocio, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si misma, se siente satisfecha porque este negocio le genera ganancias  a diarios, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. 
Maria solicita el préstamo para comprar libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, colores, engrapadoras, calculadoras, etc. Con el objetivo de agregar más útiles escolares a su librería para incrementar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela sobre todo aprovechar la apertura del año escolar.
Dentro de sus planes futuros  tiene proyectos de los cuales ella destaca  invertir en ropa de bebe, apoyar a su hijo para que el ponga su propio laboratorio solo  de informática y poner otra librería en otro colegio.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and from Managua.  She is unmarried and the mother of a twenty year old son who is studying at the university for a degree in systems engineering.  She is a merchant and has owned a bookstore for over eleven years.  She began her business with her own capital, money given to her by her companion who was a physical education teacher.  This was how she decided to start her own business.  She needed a way to survive and generate income for herself.  She is happy because this business generates profits daily and she has her son’s support.  

Maria is requesting the loan to purchase books, notebooks, pencils, markers, crayons, staplers, calculators, etc.  She plans to add more school supplies to her bookstore to increase sales and meet her customers’ needs.  Most importantly, she plans to take advantage of the opening of the school year.  Highlights of her plans for future projects include investing in baby clothes, helping her son set up his own computer lab, and establishing another bookstore in another school.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, pencils, markers, crayons, staplers, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothing retail business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her business stock as well as to open another shop.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a 36-year-old married woman and a loving mother of four children. She enjoys her business of weaving rugs and shawls. She is doing it with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. They have gained years of experience in this field and make enough to run their household expenses. Nasreen has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and her son also helps in her work making rugs and shawls. Nasreen has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her 6th loan cycle, with a good repayment history. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR. 30,000 to buy raw materials such as spools of wool, threads, cutters, and tools to increase her sales. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of wool, threads, cutters, and tools to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 65-year-old mother from Vihiga in Kakamega County. She is married and supports seven children, the last-born being 18 years old.

She sells second-hand clothes. She was introduced to KADET LTD by group members, and she makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking out her third loan with KADET LTD which she will use to purchase bales of clothes so as to increase the volume of her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

She has a dream of living a good life in her old age.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and 'tricycle' transportation.  Edna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her 'sari-sari' (variety) store.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her 'sari-sari' store.

loans.name: Sajidah

texts.en: Ms. Sajidah is a 26-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery work. She started doing this work over 9 months ago. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area. Due to increased demand for her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business. Sajidah is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demands of her embroidery business she needs to engage some more women. Now she has requested a loan of PKR. 30000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colours which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colours.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms. Shabana is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of five; three of them are school going. She has been operating a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She stitches for the people living around her home and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan PKR. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including spools of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and needles, to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including spools of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Ms. Zahida is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfil their demands including food, health, clothing and education. Zahida has been operating a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 8 years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Zahida's husband. She offers various handmade carpets in different colours, and she is famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. In order to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres Zahida requested a loan of PKR. 20000 from Kashf Foundation. It would help her to increase her sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibres.

loans.name: Liliana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Liliana de 43 años de edad, ha dedicado su vida a velar por el bienestar de su familia, los cuales son sus más grandes tesoros. Con el fin de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y mejorar las condiciones económicas, esta mujer se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, labor que le permite atender a su familia y generar ingresos de manera simultánea. Gracias a su calidad en el servicio ha incrementado el número de clientes en su sector. 
La problemática más latente a la que se enfrenta es el retrazo en los pagos por parte de sus clientes, lo que conlleva a perder liquidez, y agotar inventarios. 
Su mayor deseo es incrementar las ventas en su negocio, para garantizarle a su hijo el ingreso a la educación superior. Motivada por su gran anhelo, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía de productos de belleza. Debido a que sus clientes le demandan mayor variedad, pero por cuestiones económicas no ha logrado satisfacer el nivel de demanda.
texts.en: Liliana, 43, has dedicated her life to watching over the wellbeing of her family, which is her greatest treasure. In order to contribute to home expenses and better her economic conditions, this woman dedicates herself to selling catalogue products, a form of work that allows her to attend to her family and generate income at the same time. Due to the quality of her service, the number of customers in her area has increased. The most pressing problem she is facing is delay of payments from her customers, which results in loss of funds and inventory. Her greatest desire is to increase sales for her business in order to guarantee her son admission to higher education. Motivated by this great wish, she is requesting a loan she will invest in the purchase of beauty products and merchandise. Her customers demand greater variety, but for economic reasons, she has not been able to satisfy the level of demand.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a 49-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Pascal started selling lights in July, 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 34-year-old man who is married. He comes from Bukenye in Kakamega County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He has two children ages two and six years old.

George operates a tailoring shop in his location. He has been doing this business for eight years and makes a monthly income of KES 35,000. He is taking out his 1st loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy modern sewing machines so as to increase his business. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

He has a dream of expanding his business to open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Mission Group

texts.en:
SHAMSUDINI, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children (two girls and a boy). Two of his children are in school and the last one is still young. For a period of nine years now, he has been running a general store business selling different kinds of consumables as well as durable items. He is doing fine with his activity and his family as well. He works from 6 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to earn a good profit per month.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase more business stock, buy cupboards, finish his house, and pay school fees and household expenses, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to increase his business stock to meet the increased client demand. His dream is to one day be able to have a wholesale business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mission," which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his business stock

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza lives in the capital city Tbilisi. He is 49 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Ekaterine, three children (2, 10, and 12 years old) and his mother.  Ekaterine works as a nurse and Zaza’s mother is provided with a retirement pension. The elder children are public school attendants. 

Zaza is a taxi driver and earns daily income with his car. He decided to start his own business, but his savings are not enough to cover all the needed expenses. Zaza’s loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business startup and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zaza will start up the taxi company. He will purchase transmitters and install them in the cars. He has already registered the taxi company in his city and obtained the business license. Zaza will hire reliable and polite taxi drivers and pay the service fee. He hopes that his project will be profitable, as he has rich experience in this field. The new business initiative will increase family income, and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start up a taxi company and purchase transmitters

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 58 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurelia has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 36 years old and married to Mary, who also works. They have three children, six-year-old twins and a nine-month-old baby.

Geoffrey makes and sells bricks and has done so for the last three years. He makes a monthly income of 40,000 KES. He is applying for a 20,000 KES loan, his second with KADET. He will use the loan to buy fuel for making his bricks.

Geoffrey plans to use his anticipated profits to start a new business. His ambition is to be financially stable so he can provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fuel for making his bricks.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married to Winnie, and together they have eight children (he is shown in the photograph with his wife and the UGAFODE loan officer).They live in rural Ntungamo and depend mainly on subsistence farming to get along.

William sells milk and also has a grocery kiosk. He is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan to buy more stock for his kiosk and add more rooms to his house.

loans.use: buy more stock for his kiosk and add more rooms to his house.

loans.name: Nora Cecilia

texts.es:
Nora de 39 años de edad, es reconocida en su localidad por tener un gran carisma y preocuparse por el bienestar de su comunidad. 
Es madre soltera y cabeza de familia de 3 hijos. Sufrió el abandono de su esposo, por lo cual asumió las responsabilidades del hogar y generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos, brindándoles alimento y educación a sus hijos.
Cuenta que desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de la confección por tradición familiar, y desde que se hizo cargo de las obligaciones familiares, decidió montar su propio taller de confección a terceros. En la actualidad Nora se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina de dos agujas, que le permitirán optimizar en los tiempos de producción y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su taller de confección e incrementar las ventas, generando nuevas fuentes de empleo principalmente para madres cabeza de familia que no cuentan con oportunidades laborales. Además, sueña con que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y una condición económica estable.
texts.en:
Nora, 39, is recognized in her area for possessing great charisma and for being concerned for the wellbeing of her community. She is a single mother and head of her family of three children. Her husband abandoned her, so she assumed the responsibilities of the home and of generating enough income to pay expenses, affording her children food and education.

She says she began learning the clothing trade at a young age through family tradition, and since taking charge of family obligations, she decided to hire third parties to work in her own clothing shop. Currently, Nora is requesting a loan she will invest in the purchase of a two-needle sewing machine, which will allow her to optimize during times of production and increase revenue.

Her greatest dream is to see her clothing shop grow, increase sales and generate new sources of employment, especially for mothers who are heads of family and who do not have job opportunities. Furthermore, she hopes that her children will have a better quality of life and a stable economic condition.

loans.use: To buy a two-needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarette, fish, coffee, sugar and salt and soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sagiko, Sprite).

loans.name: Taivanjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Taivanjargal, 37 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a traditional Mongolian five-walled ger (portable felt dwelling) on land where his brother and father live in separate houses in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his daughter goes to high school. He himself renders taxi services five days each week. At first, he worked as a contract driver by using the organization’s car as a private business entity since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. Then in 2007, he transferred car ownership to his name and began rendering a taxi service. He is one of our most reliable clients and has used his previous loan for repairing his house, which belongs to his parents. When his parents came back to live in Ulaanbaatar, his family moved to a traditional Mongolian ger on the same land. 

He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase briquette, which will be used for cooking. There are many advantages to using briquettes, including its unique property of creating no smoke, soot or carbon deposits while burning; long burning duration compared to its original condition; more efficient than firewood in thermal value; and low value ash content; and is also renewable because it is made with organic materials, which are common. All of the above-mentioned advantages will help the efforts against air pollution in Mongolia. 

The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase briquettes.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Vilma, habita en la ciudad de Managua, 38 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos de 17,15 y 12 años de edad respectivamente de los cuales su hija mayor está en la universidad y los otros dos están en la secundaria. Inicio su negocio hace 10 años vendiendo comida pues es una habilidad propia y siempre ha disfrutado decidió emprender su propio puesto de  comida además que no quería trabajarle a nadie y ser ella dueña de negocio. Con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia y al mismo tiempo desarrollar sus habilidades culinarias. Otra actividad que realiza son terapias a niños con problemas neurológicos. Ella atiende su el negocio con ayuda de sus hijos y esposo.   
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar mesas plásticas, arroz, frijoles, aceite,  verduras, condimentos, empaque para comidas. Esta inversión le permitirá brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes además de tener materia prima para trabajar. Uno de sus proyectos próximos es comprar un carro para utilizarlo como taxi y de esta manera conseguir otra forma de ingreso que le ayude a mejorar  y prosperar.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the city of Managua.  She is 38 years old, married and she is the mother of three children who are 17, 15 and 12 years old, respectively.  Of her children her oldest daughter is in university and the other two are in high school.  She began her business 10 years ago selling food as it is a suitable skill and as she has always enjoyed it, she decided to start her own food stall.  In addition, she didn’t want to work for anyone and she wanted to be a business owner.  With this business she has managed to support her family and at the same time develop her culinary skills.  Another activity that she performs is therapy for children with neurological problems.  She attends to her business with help from her children and husband.

She is requesting the loan to purchase plastic tables, rice, beans, oil, vegetables, condiments and packaging for food.  This investment will allow her to provide better service to her customers as well as to have the basic ingredients for her work.  One of her next projects is to buy a car to use as a taxi and in this way obtain another form of income that will help her to improve and prosper.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tables, rice, beans, oil, vegetables, condiments and food packaging.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Sr. Vicente tiene 45 años y 5 hijos de las edades de 18, 15, 12, 8 y 2 años, el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Nuevo Surutu,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Vicente va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de Arroz  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, El Sr. Vicente enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Vicente is 45 years and has 5 children, ages 18, 15, 12, 8 and 2.  He works in agriculture, planting a variety of vegetables like potatoes, yuca and corn in his plot, which is located in the community of Nuevo Suruto.  This loan is his first within the institution.  Vicente will use this loan to sow rice and land preparation.  He is requesting this loan to obtain resources for planting and to be able to survive. 

Vicente faces challenges in his business like the harshness of the climate that at times ruins his sowing, and will use the profits to improve the quality of life of he and his family.  Since he takes care of all of the home expenses, he is a responsible and hardworking person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to sow rice.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Lilian, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children of her own and one orphan; all of them go to school. She has been running a Ggengeduka (meaning fruits, vegetable, sugar, rice, beans, etc., in the same shop) She works from 7.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a goo monthly profit.

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more fruits, vegetables and missing items in the dry foods, like sugar, wheat flour, beans, etc.; build a business premises; build a gate for her fence; pay schools fees; and cover household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, sugar, flour, beans, rice, salt and dry peas. Her dream is to one day be able to fill her shop with products because now it is big but has few products. 

Lilian will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Ulunguru," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, sugar, flour, beans, rice, salt and dry peas.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married to Charles who is a farmer and provides for the family.  They are blessed with four children aged 30, 25, 23 and 12 years old respectively.

Mary has been a dairy farmer for the last nine years and earns a monthly income of 8,300 KES. She is taking her eighth loan with KADET LTD., to buy two dairy cows. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest it back into the business.

Her dream is of running a successful business and to educate her children.

loans.use: she wants to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, 58 years old, is married and blessed with five children. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Union. She has managed a pig business for almost 5 years, and earns a net income of 3,500 PHP per hog that she sells. She would like to avail a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed to sustain their needs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 50-year- old married woman and a mother of four young children from Loboc, Bohol. Francisca is involved in a hog raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Francisca is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs.

In the future, Francisca hopes of expanding her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additonal piglets to raise

loans.name: Umangani Group

texts.en:
LEA, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two boys, one of which is in school and the remaining is still too young. LEA has been running a business selling clothes ( fabrics and madila - a kind of gown made by using fabrics) . She works from midday to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more business fabrics and other clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big clothes shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " Umangani " which totals 12 members . The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and other clothes to resell

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is 61 years old. She lives in Kvareli District alone with her granddaughter. She is 11 years old and she goes to school. Venera requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Venera makes Georgian cheese bread and distributes it to the grocery stores and the family has very small monthly income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Venera requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Venera will purchase clothes at wholesale price and then sell them for profit in her district among her neighbors. Venera will use the profit for reinvesting in the same business and renovating her house to have better conditions for her granddaughter. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 64 years old and widowed with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Norma operates a bread baking business in the local community. She has been in business for over 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 64 years old and widowed with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living Julia sells snack foods in the local community. She has been with her business for over 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month, and now she has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like sticky rice and ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like sticky rice and ingredients.

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
Olga de 51 años de edad, es una mujer que ha sido golpeada por las circunstancias de la vida. Atravesar por una crisis económica en su hogar, es uno de los sucesos que han marcado su vida y la de su esposo. A raíz de esta situación esta mujer inició con el oficio de la confección con el propósito de mitigar el panorama que asechaba su familia. “Fueron días difíciles, hasta llegué a pensar que sería el fin para nosotros” con estas palabras Olga manifiesta la pesadilla que vivieron. Pero su perseverancia y el amor por sus hijos fueron más fuertes, razón por la que trabajó fuertemente con el objetivo de que sus hijos pudieran acceder a la educación y a una mejor calidad de vida.
Olga se ha ganado el corazón y el reconocimiento de las personas de su municipio gracias a su amabilidad.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a este oficio, y con su esfuerzo a construido su taller de confección ubicado en la sala de su casa, especializándose en la elaboración de ropa interior. En la actualidad requiere de la compra de materias primas como algodón, tela e hilos, con el fin de aumentar su producción que será comercializada en varios negocios de su localidad. 
Espera que con esta inversión su calidad de vida mejore y su condición económica se estabilice.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old, and is a woman that has been beaten by life's circumstances.  Passing through an economic crisis at home is an event that has marked her life and that of her spouse.  As a result of this situation, Olga started a dressmaking business with the intention of alleviating this crisis that was threatening her family.  "They were difficult days, I even came to think that it would be the end for us."  With these words, Olga recalls the nightmare they lived through.  But her perseverance and the love for her children were stronger, and the reason that she worked so hard in order to give them access to education and a better quality of life.    

Olga has won over the hearts and recognition from people in her community thanks to her kindness.  She has made a living in this profession for 20 years, and with her efforts has built her dressmaking shop in her home's living room, specializing in the production of underwear.  Currently, she needs to buy raw materials such as cotton, fabric and threads, in order to expand her production so she can sell in various businesses around her area.  She hopes that with this investment she can improve her quality of life and stabilize her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cotton, fabric and threads

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Victoria operates a family member's motor transport service business. She has been doing this for over 5 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair a vehicle to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a 31 year old married man from Loon, Bohol. Jeffrey runs a sari-sari or general store business selling various goods and items to the people in the local area. Jeffrey is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for his store like canned goods, candies, rice, soft drinks, soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to attract and sell more to his customers.
In the future, Jeffrey hopes to expand his business and experience more of the fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for his store like canned goods, candies, rice, soft drinks, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell and earn a living in the local community. She operated her business for over 5 years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Arlyn owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell and earn a living. She has operated her business for 5 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Arlyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old, he is married and he and his wife have been blessed with two children whose ages are one and five.
