Edwin has been operating a motorbike transportation business for the last four years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 30,500, he is taking his first loan with KADET LTD., which he will add to some of his savings to purchase a new motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into his business.

He has a dream of owning a fleet of motorbikes for purposes of transport. For his family, he wants to be able to provide adequately for them.

loans.use: to help purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Jenry

texts.en: Jenry is 33 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and manages a cellphone accessories business in his local community to earn a living. He has operated his business for over 4 years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. Now, he has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional products like cellphones and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like cellphones and accessories

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house repairing motorcycles.  She is making a good income from this business and she wants to buy more stock with the loan such as oil, wheels, a compressor and spark plugs and to pay wages to the mechanic who works for her. She is living in a town near by the main road, so many people come to fix their motorcycles at her place. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy oil, wheels, a compressor and spark plugs

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 24 years old and a single mother of one child who is 3 years old.

She has been selling second hand clothes for the last two years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 10,000, and she is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase her stock by purchasing more bails of second hand clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to invest back in her business.

Her dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase more bails of second hand clothes

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Agnessy is 30 and lives together with her husband. For one year now, Agnessy has been operating a grocery business . She is doing fine with the business and her family is well. She works from 4pm to midnight daily and is able to earn a fair profit each month. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more beer, soda, water and juices to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a big bar. 

Agnessy will share this loan with her loan group, "Ustawi," which has 11 members . The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda, water and juice to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell and earn a living. She has operated her business for over 5 years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita is 63 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business raising pigs to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been operating her business for over 6 years and earns 13,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a farm, which sells bananas in the local community, to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 9 years and earns 13,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Dur. She owns and operates a fish business, selling to customers in the local community, to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 9 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC last year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. And now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like fish and shrimp. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like fish and shrimp

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged with her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 11,300 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a pedicab transportation business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 6 years and earns 2,500P HP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase tires for her pedicab. In the future, Lorna wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her pedicab

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед женат и имеет одного ребенка. Ему 31 лет. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Рудаки. Джамшед в течение 13 лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает бычков, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает их на скотном рынке своего района. Жена усердно помогает в его деятельности. Джамшед берет кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли он надеется расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Jamshed is 31 years old, married, and has one child.  He and his family live in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan.  Jamshed has worked with livestock for thirteen years.  He buys bulls, fattens them over a period of a few months and then sells them at a regional cattle market.  His wife works hard to help him with these tasks.  Jamshed is taking out a loan to assist in buying and selling cattle.  With the profits provided by the loan, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy and sell cattle in order with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 27 years old and is a single mom with one child. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been engaged with her business for over 3 years and earns 13,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is 35 years old and married with one child. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a pedicab transportation business in the local community to earn a living. She has operated her business for over 3 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new tires. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a fish selling business to earn a living in the local community. She has been with her business for over 5 years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. And now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 55 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 6 years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she had requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar. In the future, She wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Ochmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Ochmaa is 34 years old and  lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a Ger (a Mongolian traditional tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Otgonbayar, aged 41, cuts the wood to order with his own electric saw. Her daughter, Handmaa, aged 13, studies at a local school and other daughter Chimedmaa, aged 5, goes to a local kindergarten. Her husband is planning to start his own business in firewood retail in the local market since he has lots of experience and he has the equipment and tools. Ochmaa is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of wood to produce firewood to sell to local customers. Her husband is a hardworking, helpful and ethical man.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of wood to produce firewood to sell to local customers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and is married to Everline who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children aged six, four and one.

Samuel operates a motorcycle transportion business, he has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 35,000. He has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase spare parts for his motorbike . The anticipated profit will be used to buy a new motorbike.

He has a dream to be able to provide for his family and be a successful businessman in the region.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Rispa

texts.en:
Rispa is a 56 year old lady from Kisumu County. She is a single mother of three children who are 18, 16 and 12.

She has been operating a small food stall for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase cooking oil, sugar and add more plastic seats for her customers. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of opening a big hotel.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar and plastic seats

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a married woman and a mother of two grown children from Loon, Bohol. She has operated a sari-sari or variety store business for more than 10 years now. This is her only source of income.
Rufa is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, sugar, soap, soda and other beverages. With this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store. In the future, Rufa hopes to continue and increase the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, sugar, soap, soda and other beverages

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Oyuntsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in a Ger (a traditional Mongolian tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Amgalanbaatar, is currently unemployed and is helping his wife to run her organic dairy product sales business. Her daughters Nemehjargal, aged 18, and Naranzaya, aged 11, and sons Ariunbold, Ariunbileg, and Amarbold, aged 16, 13 and 7 respectively, are all studying at local schools. She has been operating her organic dairy products business at a rental counter of a local market since 2000. She has gained a lot of experience, customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase large amount of organic dairy products from herders to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking and modest woman who says, "My children are soon to be university students and I will have tuition fees to pay so I need to save for their education."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders to sell to local customers

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is a single mother of 5 and is 45 years old. She has a restaurant and deals in the banana trade. She first took a loan of 500.000 UGX which she paid well and now wants a loan of 700.000 UGX to buy organic manure for her plantain farm, she will use the balance to pay for tuition fees for her children. She hopes the manure will increase her plantain production and she will therefore invest the gained profit in her restaurant and hopefully her revenue will eventually double. She can then construct a building to house her restaurant in the future instead of renting. She is optimistic about her family's future,  especially now that she will be partnering with Kiva lenders. Her major challenges are a lack of customers, customers who eat on credit and take long time to pay and a limited capital base which has to be shared between sustaining her business and paying tuition.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 43 years old, she and her fiancee live in Congo Town, Montserrado County which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancee is a carpenter and they have four children between the ages of 12 and 25, only one of them attends school and two of them live at home. Since 2010, she has been selling used clothes in her community market, sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money, she is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business, in the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Mr. Purevsuren is 54 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a Ger (a traditional Mongolian tent) in Tosontsengel village of Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Chimedtseren, aged 53, helps her husband to run their organic vegetable growing and sales business. His children Uuganbaatar, aged 15 and Enhsaihan, aged 11 study at local schools. Purevsuren moved to the provincial center in 2010 and started his organic vegetable growing business. He and his wife have gained a lot of experience in the business and now he is requesting loan of 350,000 MNT to purchase materials to build a cellar to store their organic vegetables and sell to local customers. He and his wife are hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a cellar to store his organic vegetables and sell to local customers

loans.name: Ketra

texts.en:
Ketra is 67 years old and a widow with ten (10) children. She lives in Nyamambo, Kebisoni – Rukungiri, Uganda. After her husband died a long time ago, she started providing for the whole family and had to earn a living. She now rears cattle for a living where she breeds various kinds and types of cattle. This project greatly improved the livelihood of her family. Her children are now grown-ups and can fend for themselves.
With this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) - Rukungiri Branch, she is going to buy more farm inputs and the necessary equipment involved in cattle fattening in order to increase the sales of the animals in the competitive market.
Ketra now manages her cattle business very well and she is grateful for UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for its services.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and other necessary equipment to raise cattle.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She owns a salon and also sells clothes. She has been doing this business for the last 20 years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

She is taking third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase new stock for her salon. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and expand her business.
She has a dream of becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase hair drier and other items for her salon.

loans.name: Taivanbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Taivanbaatar is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Ariunbileg has graduated from nursing school and is now staying home to take care of her newborn baby daughter Davaahishig, 8 months old. Taivanbaatar has been helping his father and brother since he was young to craft wooden items. He is a well-experienced and hardworking man who is now requesting 1,400,000 MNT to purchase inventory to start his own business of crafting wooden musical instruments in his spare room at home.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to craft wooden musical instruments.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
This is Rica. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more ingredients which resulted in a higher income. She also has a variety store. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and products needed in her business. The loan will also be used to buy items for her variety store. The profits from her businesses will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rica hopes for good health for the whole family and dreams of being able to expand her businesses. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her life and business where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like sugar, bananas and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Doña Gladis, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio del negrito, Yoro con sus dos nietos. Ella lleva tres años de dedicarse a la venta de edredones, colas para cabello hechos manualmente, aretes, pulseras cadenas de oro, fantasía y plata. Ella ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por 11,000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio de mercadería y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su sueño es ser independiente y lograr construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Doña Gladis is 57 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives with two grandchildren in the town of Negrito, Yoro.

For the past three years, Gladis has been selling bedspreads, handmade hair clips, earrings, bracelets, gold chains, costume jewelry, and silver. She decided to request her second loan in the amount of 11,000 HNL. The money will be used to restock her business with more merchandise so that she can offer variety to her customers. Her dream is to be independent and to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, jewelry, and materials for making handmade hair clips.

loans.name: Karamatkhan

texts.ru:
Караматхан 49 лет, замужем и имеет 8 детей, 4 сыновей и 4 дочерей.По хозяйству активно помогает муж и дети. Караматхан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 2001 году. Караматхан начала свой бизнес с 10,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Караматхан имеется 6 дойных коров, 6 телок, 19 бычков, 2 лошади и 1 жеребенок. И обрабатывает 4 га земли.   В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Караматхан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян помидоров и картошки.
Планирует получить хорошую прибыль от проекта. Дохода планирует направить на улучшение материального положения семьи
texts.en:
Karamatkhan is 49 years old, she is married and has eight children - four sons and four daughters. Her husband and children actively help her in the business. Karamatkhan started her business in animal husbandry and plant cultivation in 2001 with 10,000 KGS. Today her business has six milk cows, six heifers, nineteen calves, two horses and one colt, as well as four hectares of arable land. Karamatkhan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy potato and tomato seeds with the goal to further grow her business.

She plans to receive a good profit from the project and invest it into improvement of her family financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase tomato and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sundaymah

texts.en: Sundaymah is 44 years old and lives in Montserrado County, the largest port and number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with seven children between the ages of 13 and 28, six  of whom attend high school and one attends college.  All her children live at home. She has been selling charcoal for the past 30 years.  She started this business from running a restaurant, with money given to her by her husband, and now she sells bags of charcoal in her community.  She gained expertise in the business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her good profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell, in the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Rodrigo Arturo

texts.es:
Rodrigo, es un joven de 21 años de edad, que se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante. Decidió montar su propio negocio debido a que vio en el sector la oportunidad de formar empresa, por lo cual no perdió la oportunidad de convertirse en independiente. Gracias a su trabajo, este joven genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus padres. 
Su tienda ha adoptado la forma de miscelánea debido a la variedad de productos que oferta. Su negocio es el único punto del sector en donde hay expendio de gas, lo que se convierte en una de su mayores ventajas frente a al competencia. 
Gracias  a la buena acogida de sus productos y servicios, Rodrigo se en encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y gas para aumentar su inventario y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es seguir aumentando sus ingresos para garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 21 years old and can be characterised as a hard-working young man who, thanks to his own efforts, has been able to move forward in life. 

He decided to start his own business as he saw an opportunity in the market for it.  He didn't lose any time in becoming independent and, because of his work, this young man generates enough income to support his parents.  

Rodrigo runs a general store, with quite a variety of products offered.  His business is the only place in the area that sells gas, an advantage to him over his competitors.

Following the fact that his products and services have been well received, Rodrigo is now applying for a loan that will allow him to buy basic staple goods and gas to increase his stock levels and satisfy his customers' needs.

Rodrigo's big dream is to continue increasing his income so as to guarantee a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy staple products and gas.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 37-year-old single mother with two children, ages 18 and 16 years respectively. She sells cereals and she has been in business for eight years, right now her monthly income is KES. 20,000. She is requesting a loan of KES. 50,000 which she will use to add more stock of assorted cereals i.e. dry maize, beans and peas to sell.

She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profits. This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to buy land and a vehicle.

loans.use: to add more stock of assorted cereals e.g dry maize, beans and peas to sell.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: El Sr. Sebastián  tiene 27 años, con un hijito que tiene la edad de 9 meses,  el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Nuevo Surutu,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Sebastián  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de mani y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida  de su familia El Sr. Sebastián  es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sebastián is 27 years old and has a young baby, who is nine months old.  He makes a living in agriculture, sowing various vegetables, including potatoes, yucca and corn on his plot of land in the Nuevo Surutu community.  This loan is his first cycle with the institution.  Sebastián is going to use the loan to sow peanuts, which also means he has to prepare the land.  His reason for applying for this loan is so that he can have the resources for sowing his crops and to be able to survive.  He will use the profits to improve his family's quality of life.  Sebastián is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support that is being provided.

loans.use: to sow peanuts.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra de 42 años de edad, es una mujer campesina. Reside desde su infancia en una vereda del municipio de Santa Bárbara. Se ha dedicado a labrar el campo, actividad que le ha permitido generar el sustento para ella y su familia, quienes están a su cargo.
Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena con la recolecta del café, y posteriormente comienza a realizar las labores domésticas del hogar.
Su actividad es la única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos en su hogar. Por lo cual trabaja arduamente a fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida. 

Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, adecuación de terreno y mano de obra con el fin de mejorar el cultivo y obtener una mayor producción que se reflejará en mayores ingresos y estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Forty-two year old Sandra is from the countryside.  Since she was a child she has lived in the small town of Santa Bárbara.  She has made a living working in the fields and this has allowed her to earn enough to support her family, whom she is responsible for.  

Every day she gets up very early and starts her work, collecting the coffee.  Later she begins to do her household chores.  Her work is the only income that goes to paying the household bills and so Sandra works very hard with the aim of improving her living conditions.

She is now applying for a loan to buy fertiliser, to adapt the land and pay for labourers, in order to improve her crop and increase production.  This will then result in a higher income and more stability for the family.

loans.use: to pay for fertiliser, to adapt the land and pay for labourers.

loans.name: Luis Eudoro

texts.es:
LUIS EUDORO tiene 53 años de edad es soletro tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en casa que le dejarón los padres en Chillanes.

Es Integrante de la VRC ARRAYAPAMBA se encuentra formada por 12 socios que son de la misma comunidad, a 25 minutos de la Oicina de la Cooperativa, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio. 

LUIS EUDORO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos, pollos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger, herbicidas, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar semillas que le hace falta para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad Chillanes.

El sueño es comprar terreno, aumentar la producción y mejorar el estilo de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de capital para poder trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir, hacer deporte y disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Luis Eudoro is 53 years old, single, and has one child. He and his son live in a house in Chillanes that was left to him by his parents.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Arrayapamba”, which consists of 12 members who are from the same community. They live 25 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members engage in business activities such as farming, raising animals, and trade.

Luis Eudoro is a farmer who grows beans and blackberries. He also raises and fattens pigs, chickens, and cattle so that they can be sold. Luis is requesting a loan in order to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger (a brand of pesticide), herbicides, and urea. With the help of this loan, he will also be able to buy the seeds that he lacks for farming. His purchases are conducted in the city of Chillanes. His dream is to buy land so that he can increase production and improve his lifestyle. The challenges he faces include dealing with the lack of capital that he needs for his work.

In his free time, Luis Eudoro likes to go out, play sports, and enjoy the community festivals.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, pesticide, herbicides, and urea.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose. Her previous loan was a big help to her. She was able to buy more products and items for the pharmacy thus generating more income. She also has a food stall where she sells buko juice and different viands. She is also a mineral water distributor. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy different merchandise products for the pharmacy; medicines and other supplies. She will also use the money to buy mineral water and different ingredients for her food stall. Her profits from her businesses will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose dreams to give her children a good life and education and hopes that her businesses will get bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional medicine, mineral water and other products needed in her businesses.

loans.name: Tomorbat

texts.en: Mr. Tomorbat is 45 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Ulamsaihan, age 44, provides tailoring services from their home. His daughters Oyun-Erdene (19) is university student, Oyunbileg (15) and son Erdenebileg (6) go to local schools. Tomorbat has been selling organic dairy products at a rental counter of a local market. He purchases organic dairy products from herders in the countryside, collects them in his own van and sells to local customers at his rental counter. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase larger amounts of organic dairy products from herders to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking, friendly and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of organic dairy products.

loans.name: David F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Koidu. They have come to Kiva field partner Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to request a loan of 14,900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. For example, some of them will use this loan to pay school fees for their children, others will use it to buy house building materials, and some will invest in their side businesses. And at the end of each month, they can use their monthly salaries to make payments on their loan. It is their school's bursar whose has the responsibility to deduct the repayments and repay SMT/Kiva lenders on the teachers’ behalf.
David is the featured leader of this group. A native of Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, the 61-year-old is married to a teacher and the two have 4 children, 3 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. David has been a professional teacher for 39 years now. With his share of the loan, he is going to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, etc. to construct a house for his family.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Erick was born in 1964 to a peasant family. He is married with five (5) children who are attending schools.
He started the business of cattle trading in 1998 with limited capital. He struggled to run the business, which was his major source of income for all his financial needs for several years.
In 2010, he found out that it was difficult for him to maintain his business and meet his family’s needs and educating his children. He joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri Branch to get financial assistance to boost his business and got help with his cattle trading.
Erick has been able to educate his children without affecting his business with the loans from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). He uses these loans to buy cows and sell them to butchers and butcheries at relatively profitable amounts. This has enabled him to meet his family obligations and maintain his business empire. Erick also praises UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial support which it extends to low income earners.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Mrs. Tsend-Ayush is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons in a ger in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. Her husband Batbold, age 47, is a woodsman and works on their plot of land. Their sons Osohbayar, age 10 and Osoh-Erdene, age 7 go to local schools. Tsend-Ayush has been helping her husband to run his wooden craft manufacturing business and now she is starting her own general store with her sister in a rental space. She is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and a heating system and get it installed in her new workplace. She is an open-minded, positive and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and  heating system and get it installed.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo sigue con la misma actividad de la fabricación de artesanías el fabrica rompecabezas para niños,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material para la fabricación de mas rompecabezas,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material
Incremento su producción  ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos por mayor y se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que creció en su actividad.
texts.en: Hugo continues working as a craftsman, making children's jigsaw puzzles.  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy materials which he needs to make more jigsaws.  He says that his previous loan was very helpful as he used it to buy materials which increased his production.  He now has customers who place wholesale orders with him.  He feels happy with the loan that he received as it gave him the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jigsaw puzzles

loans.name: Santos Rosa

texts.es: La señora Santos, de 57 años de edad es madre soltera de 7 hijos todos casados y le ayudan en sus gastos, antes hacia tortillas, pero era muy desgastante y no le era rentable las ventas y opto por trabajar como empleada domestica en casa particular, donde se siente más tranquila brindando sus servicios. Este es su primer crédito solicitado para construir cuartos, comprara bloques, cemento hierro, arena, piedrines, esto será el comienzo para ir poco a poco haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda lo que la llena de ilusión, gracias al poyo de financiamiento.
texts.en:
57-year-old Santos is a single mother with seven children who are all married and help her with expenses.  In the past, Santos made tortillas for a living but it was very tiring and her sales were not profitable.  For this reason, she chose to work as a domestic employee in a private home instead.  She now feels happier in her work.

This is the first loan that Santos has requested to carry out building work.  She will buy blocks, cement, iron, sand and gravel in order to build rooms.  Thanks to the support of this loan, she will be able to start making improvements to her home and this fills her with excitement.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand and gravel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers so that he can improve his farm produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance work on his mill, including lubrication and replacing some parts.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es: La señora Celia, siendo madre soltera de 3 hijos salió adelante con ellos brindándoles educación alimentación y calor de madre ahora son mayores y casados quienes le ayudan económicamente, ella continua con su labor de empleada domestica, siendo su principal fuente de ingresos la costura para poder cubrir con todos sus gastos mensuales. Solicita el crédito para entechar parte de la sala y porche de la casa para dar mejores condiciones  a su hogar más ahora que se acerca el invierno, comprara láminas de zinc y perlines para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
Celia is a single mother.  She has three children who she has provided with an education, food and a mother's love.  They are all now grown up and married, and help her out financially.

Celia continues working as a domestic employee and also provides sewing services in order to cover all her monthly expenses.  She is requesting this loan to roof part of her living room and porch so that she can improve the condition of her home.  This is particularly important as winter is approaching.  She will buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams so that the work can begin.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Gloria Del Rosario

texts.es: Gloria de 46 años de edad, trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado regional, ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabaja. Gloria vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y así mismo junto a un hijo. Gloria se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace muchos años, a lo largo de todo este tiempo ha buscado mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus productos para atender a más personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en mejoras de su hogar, reparando el techo y de este modo tener una casa segura durante el invierno, así mismo reforzará las paredes y las puertas. Gloria y su esposo son muy responsables y trabajadores algo muy positivo para ellos.
texts.en:
46-year-old Gloria works selling fruit and vegetables in the regional market.  She is a woman who is very committed to her work.  Gloria lives with her husband, who works as a builder, and their son.  She has been selling vegetables for a long time and, over the years, she has worked hard to improve her business and increase the range of products she offers so that she can serve more people.

Gloria is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in making some improvements to her house.  This will give her a secure home in time for the winter.  She will repair her roof and also strengthen the walls and doors.  Gloria and her husband are very hard-working and responsible people which is very much to their benefit.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella vive junto a su madre y tres hijos menores de edad, María trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia ya que es madre soltera, lo cual no le ha impedido darles todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Ella posee un negocio propio en el mercado de la zona, en el que comercializa frutas y verduras, tiene más de cinco años de estar ubicada en el mismo lugar, lo que le ha permitido contar con clientes fijos y ser recomendada. María es una mujer responsable, honesta y sobretodo con deseos de superación. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas de la temporada, debido a que se acerca la semana santa desea comprar jocotes, mangos y dulces por mayor,  así mismo pescado seco ya que esta es una comida típica de la temporada. María desea ver sus ventas incrementadas para poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en: 42-year-old María is a tenacious lady who has a great desire to make progress in life.  She lives with her mother and three dependent children.  María has worked very hard to provide for her family as she is a single mother.  She has not let her situation prevent her from providing her children with everything they need to live a decent life.  María owns her own business in the local market where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She has been working from this same spot for more than five years which has enabled her to gain regular customers and receive recommendations.  María is a responsible, honest woman who has a desire to improve herself.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying a larger quantity of vegetables and seasonal fruit.  As Easter is approaching, she would like to buy 'jocotes' (a native fruit), mangos and sweet treats wholesale.  She will also buy dried fish as this is traditional seasonal food.  María hopes to see her sales increase so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fruit and fish to sell

loans.name: Alba Liseth

texts.es: Alba de 37 años de edad, es una persona amable y trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta de pollo, mariscos, tostadas, gaseosas y otros productos más. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos que se dedican a estudiar. Alba es responsable con todas sus obligaciones y en el mercado en que vende sus productos es muy buscada por las personas ya que ella siempre cuenta con mariscos y pollo fresco. Alba solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mariscos como: pescado, conchas, camarón fresco y seco; también para comprar menudos de pollo, nombre que se le da al corazón, molleja, hígados y otros más, los cuales las personas utilizan para hacer sopas. Alba podrá mejorar su negocio gracias a esta ayuda que INTEGRAL le brinda y mejorar sus ganancias diarias.
texts.en: Alba is 37 years old. She is a cheerful and hard-working person, who works selling chicken, seafood, tostadas, soft drinks and other products. She lives with her husband and three children, who are in school. Alba is responsible with all of her obligations, and in the market where she sells her products, she is very sought-after by people since she always has fresh seafood and chicken. Alba is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy a greater quantity of seafood, such as fish, shellfish, and fresh and dried shrimp. She will also buy "menudos" or chicken innards, the name that is given to the heart, sweetbreads, livers and other parts, which people use to make soups. Thanks to this help which INTEGRAL is providing to her, Alba will be able to improve her business and increase her daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy seafood and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 29-year-old single mother from Lambwe in Homabay county Kenya; she is blessed with four children, whom she supports in her family, 

Maurine operates a green grocery stall and she has been in this business for the last eight years and earns a  monthly income of KES. 70,000. She is taking a second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to expand the business by purchasing tomatoes in bulk to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of living a better life and changing her business into a large one.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes in bulk for sale

loans.name: Hector Hernan

texts.es: Héctor de 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo menor de edad que se dedica a estudiar. Héctor es un hombre responsable y emprendedor  que tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante y dar lo mejor para su familia quien depende por completo de él. Héctor posee un taller mecánico en el que se dedica a reparar motos y a vender accesorios como llantas, espejos, y otros más. Héctor desea mejorar su negocio,  incrementando la cantidad de accesorios que comercializa, así mismo quiere comprar repuestos para motos y herramientas para repararlas, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda obtener lo antes mencionado y así brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Héctor is 36 years old. He lives together with his wife and one minor child who is in school. Héctor is a responsible and enterprising man who has a great desire to get ahead and to provide the best for his family, who depend completely on him. Héctor has a mechanic's workshop, where he works repairing motorcycles and also sells accessories such as tires, mirrors and others. Héctor would like to improve his business and increase the quantity of accessories he sells, and thus he would like to buy spare parts for motorcycles and tools to repair them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to obtain the items mentioned above and thus provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair motorcycles, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a hard-working and determined women who seeks to get ahead in life. She is married and has one child with her husband. They earn their living through farming basic crops such as maize and  beans  small scale, and then selling the produce in the areas surrounding her town, at the local market and from her house. She has worked in agriculture for over five years.

She requested a loan amounting to Ksh.30,000 to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm so as to improve their farm produce. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm so as to improve their farm produce.

loans.name: Gulo

texts.en:
Gulo is 64 years old. She lives in the Sighnaghi District with her husband and a grandson who goes to the local school. She requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start an agricultural business, but did not have success. Her loan requests were rejected every time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly retirement pension of Gulo and her husband. Seasonally, the family sells the harvested maize that was grown on the family-owned land. It is hardly enough for the family to cover everyday expanses. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category. 

Gulo requested a loan from Credo to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program loans money for business start-ups and "re-startups." It provides access to credit with less rigid conditions for the country's rural poor, who usually do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the loan, Gulo will purchase a milk cow. She will place it in the old, empty farm building located in their yard. She will work hard on the farm. She will produce cheese and sell it in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Gulo and her husband will be able to spend their senility in a more comfortable environment and rear their grandson to be well-educated as well. Gulo awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow for starting a dairy business.

loans.name: Purevdulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevdulam is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a 'ger' in the Narantuul area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband Enhbold, age 32, has been running his own business, a general store, in the local market since 2006. Her daughter Hongorzul, age 4, goes to local kindergarten.

This borrower has been helping her husband to run their general store in a rented counter of the local market for some years. They import inventory from China and sell it to local customers. They transport their goods by train and use a taxi or other transportation to bring them from the train station to the market.  Mrs. Purevdulam is now requesting a loan of 5,250,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce their transportation expenses. She and her husband are hardworking, responsible and friendly people.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce their transportation expenses

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George used his previous loan to add more stock to his business and right now his monthly income is KES. 20,000. He is borrowing a loan of KES 90,000 which he plans to use to add more stock of charcoal for sale.  

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees  for his children. This is his third loan and he successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal to his business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 4 and 15. They all attend school and  live at home. 

She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past two years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, from whom she learned this business. Her favorite part about her business is the profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business.  In future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is forty-eight years old and lives in her own house with her four children, ages 12,14,16 and 18, in Mwambalasi, Kenya. She owns and operates a clothing stall. She sells secondhand clothing, such as trousers, t-shirts, blouses, dresses and other items. She has been doing this work on her own for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan amounting to 40,000 KES to buy clothing items such as blouses, shirts, trousers and t-shirts. She is very grateful for the opportunity of a loan that she has been given, and for the financial support she needs to move forward.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell, such as blouses, shirts, trousers and t-shirts.

loans.name: Ruqiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Ruqiatu from Calabatown in Sierra Leone.  She is married with two children, aged 9 and 15.  They are both currently attending school.

Ruqiatu sells beans, 'benneh' (sesame) and groundnuts.  She started her business in 2000 because she needed to create more income.  She finds that the increase in transportation cost is her greatest challenge.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more beans and 'benneh' (sesame) to expand her business.  She hopes to one day become a producer of domestic goods.  She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more beans and 'benneh' (sesame) to expand her business

loans.name: Mohamed M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers in one of the secondary schools in the city of Koidu in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, Kiva’s earliest field partner, to request a loan of 8,100,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their immediate and most pressing needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for calculating the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mohamed is the featured leader of the team. He is a 33-year-old. He is a native of Kaambo village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children who are attending primary schools. Mohamed has been a professional teacher for 5 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en: Drocella is a 42-year-old woman from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Drocella started selling lights in December, 2012, and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Please meet 30-year-old Mariatu from Sierra Leone.  She is married with two children, aged 10 and 12 years old.  

Mariatu sells provisions and foodstuffs in the Waterloo area.  Three years ago, she started her business to help her husband educate her children.  She says that transportation is a difficulty that her business faces.  She plans to use the loan to buy more inventory for her business.  She hopes to use the extra income for the education of her children.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County that is has the largest Free Port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children six months old and 8 years old. Only one is attending  school and both of them live at home. She has been selling palm oil, peppers, rice, onions, garlic, etc. for the past seven years. She says her main challenge is that the transportation cost. 

Sarah started this business with money given to her by her fiancee and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and what make her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, peppers, rice, onions, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for her children in future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, peppers, rice, onions, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 27 years old and single. She is a poultry farmer raising indigenous chickens. The products she gets (eggs) she sells to the local residents and business people - a business she has been doing for two years.

She has requested a loan amounting to KES10,000 to buy more chicks to raise and sell later for profit. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell later for profit.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is a 38-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Desire started selling lights in December, 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife, Uwamariya Dativa.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Abdulai from Waterloo, outside the capital city of Freetown. He is married with one child, age 2.  

Abdulai has been operating a general store, selling goods such as shoes for the past 11 years. He started his business when he stopped attending school, because the situation was too difficult for his family. He works 10 hours per day, 7 days per week at his business.  

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise, including shoes and general clothing. His dream is to become a wholesale businessman. He hopes that the extra income will help him continue to grow his business and develop the economic state of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, including shoes and general clothing.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli, age 31, is a farmer. He lives in a village in the Baghdati district with his parents, wife and an infant daughter.  Irakli keeps busy running the family's small-scale agricultural business. He owns a vineyard and sells the harvested grapes seasonally. Also, he has five bee hives with bee colonies and the honey produced is sold locally. Besides this, Irakli’s father works as a builder and earns a small monthly income. 

Irakli has requested credit for the purpose of building a greenhouse. The new business will be an additional source of income for the family, which will allow them to combat the poverty in which they live. Irakli’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program offers business start-up capital and re-startup credit with generous lending conditions to country rural poor, who often do not have access to credit as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Irakli will purchase materials for the greenhouse construction (iron pillars and polyethylene covering) and will then construct the greenhouse, where mushrooms will be grown throughout the year. Irakli will work in the greenhouse himself. He will sell the harvested products at the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a greenhouse business

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en: Adrien is a 36-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Adrien started selling lights in December, 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife Mutezinka Laurence.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has no children. 

Abibatu sells building materials on Mangrove Road. She works there 11 hours a day, 6 days a week. She started her business 12 years ago. She says that the transportation of materials from the point of purchase to her storage space is her business' greatest challenge.

She requests the loan to purchase more cement, iron rods, paint and nails in order to expand her business.  Eventually, she wants to run a distribution company for the materials. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase cement, iron rods, paint and nails for her business.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 45-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Vincent started selling lights in December, 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife Kabasinga Marie Rose.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Dora Erlinda

texts.es: Dora de 54 años de edad, es una persona que ha trabajado muy duro durante años para salir adelante, actualmente posee una tienda de productos varios como: ropa, sandalias, papelería, pegamentos, accesorios para regalo, medicinas, pan, huevos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Así mismo ella se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles que también comercializa en su negocio. Dora vive junto a una hija y dos nietas menores de edad. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas, así mismo para invertir en más productos para la tienda y de esta manera ser la número uno en las opciones de las personas que residen en los alrededores. Esto le permitirá contar con más ganancias y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Dora, age 54, is a person who has worked very hard throughout the years in order to get ahead.  She currently has a store with various products like clothes, sandals, stationery items, glue, gift items, over the counter medicines, bread, eggs, and other basic needs items.

At the same time she works in agriculture.  She grows corn and beans, which she also sells in her business.

She lives with one daughter and two minor granddaughters.

She is requesting a loan from Integral.  This way she will buy farming supplies.  She will also invest in more products for the store.  This way she will be the number one choice of the people who live in the surrounding areas.  This will allow her to have more income and to live better.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Janiestta

texts.en:
Janiestta is 36 years old and is single with four children between three and 17. Her children are in school and they live at home. Janiestta lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest county in Freeport and the number one commercial county in Liberia. For the past eight years, she has been selling charcoal. Janiestta started her business with a loan that she took from a club (group saving account), and she learned her business from friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. 

Janiestta is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. In the future, she wants to educate her children and build a house. Janiestta appreciates the supporters of BRAC and she promise to pay back her loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 26 years old and she is from Yerevan. She lives with her parents and sister and she is a student at Yerevan Northern University in the economics department. Along with her studies, Nona works at local company to help her parents provide for the family. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for Nona to save money to cover her university tuition. 

Nona is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. Her loan will allow her to complete her education. In the future, Nona plans to find a better job and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy organic manure for his plantation

loans.name: Daniel Ernesto

texts.es: daniel es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, a su edad se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y darles todo lo necesario a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijos de tres años de edad,  juntos a quienes reside. Daniel posee su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la venta de celulares, recargas de saldo, estuches, cargadores, chips para celulares y otros más. Daniel sostiene su hogar de las ganancias generadas de este negocio, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y así poder comprar mayor cantidad de estuches en distintos colores, estilos y para diferentes modelos de celulares, así también poder adquirir más saldo y surtir más toda la tienda. Daniel es un joven que ha sabido salir adelante gracias a su enorme esfuerzo por lo que desea poder mejorar día con día, lo que podrá lograr gracias a este préstamo.
texts.en: Daniel is a very responsible and hard-working youth. At his young age he works very hard to get ahead and to provide all the necessities for his partner and their little child, age three, who lives with them. Daniel has his own business where he sells cell phones, talk refill cards, cases, chargers, chips, and other items for cell phones. Daniel supports his household with his income from this business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a larger quantity of cases in various colours and styles, and for different cell models. He will also purchase more talk refill cards and stock his store more. Daniel is a youth who has been able to get ahead thanks to his great hard work. He wants to be able to improve day by day, and he will be able to do so thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories and talk refill cards for cell phones.

loans.name: Elenilson Antonio

texts.es: Elenilson de 33 años de edad, es padre y un esposo responsable y trabajador, él vive junto a su compañera de vida y una pequeña hija, Elenilson posee un taller de mecánica en el cual se dedica a reparar carros y así mismo a vender llantas y otros repuestos, así mismo tiene una tienda en la que comercializa productos de primera necesidad, golosinas, medicinas y otros más, en este negocio le ayuda su esposa, complementándose ambos para poder contar con una vida digna y estable. Elenilson solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos para automóviles, así mismo desea invertir en la compra de más productos para la tienda como: golosinas, pan, verduras, huevos, leche, detergentes,  y otros más que cuentan con gran demanda. Mejorando ambos negocios  Elenilson podrá contar con una vida mejor para su familia y para él.
texts.en: Elenilson is 33 years old. He is a father and a hard working, responsible husband.  He lives with his wife and their young daughter. Elenilson owns a car repair shop where he also sells tires and other spare parts. In addition, he has a store where he sells basic staples such as sweets, medicine, etc. His wife helps him with this business. By working together they are creating a stable life and earning a decent living. Elenilson is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which he will use to buy a large quantity of spare automotive parts. He also wants to buy more products for his store such as sweets, bread, vegetables, eggs, milk, detergents and other products that are in high demand. By improving both businesses, Elenilson will be able to provide a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: purchase spare automotive parts and products for his store.

loans.name: Aracema Madilia

texts.es: Aracema es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre está en busca de mejorar cada día más. Ella vive junto a una hija y una pequeña nieta. Aracema trabaja muy duro en su propio negocio el cual es una pequeña librería en la que también comercializa sandalias, cremas, maquillaje, tientes para el cabello, el negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y es bastante estable ya que es el único en la zona. Así mismo para obtener más ganancias, Aracema vende ropa de forma ambulante, contando con varios clientes fijos. Aracema solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo invertir en la compra de más productos para librería, sandalias, ropa, y cosméticos, de este modo Aracema mejorará sus ventas y contará con una vida estable y mejor.
texts.en: Aracema is a very hard-working woman who is always looking to improve with every day. She lives with one daughter and a little granddaughter. Aracema works very hard in her business, a small bookstore, where she also sells sandals, creams, makeup, and hair dye. Her business is located in her home and it is quite stable, since it is the only store of its kind in the area. In order to make an income, Aracema also sells clothing door-to-door. She has several fixed clients. She is requesting a loan from Integral, which she will invest in the purchase of more stationery products, clothing, and cosmetics. Aracema will be able to improve her sales and have a better, stable life.

loans.use: to buy stationery products, as well as sandals, clothing, and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos pequeños. Ana es una madre muy responsable quien siempre desea lo mejor para sus hijos, es por esta razón que ella posee un negocio propio en el que comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: alimentos enlatados, congelados, huevos, granos básicos, productos de limpieza, golosinas y otras más, esto le permite brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar lo que representa una gran ayuda económica. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en la compra de mayor mercadería y surtir más la tienda, de este modo Ana podrá seguir proveyendo a su familia y contar con una estabilidad mejor.
texts.en: Ana, age 40, lives with her husband and two small children. Ana is a very responsible mother who always wants the best for her children. For this reason, she has her own business where she sells basic staples such as: canned goods, frozen goods, eggs, grains, cleaning products, and candies. This allows her to help her husband with the household costs, and it is a great support. Ana is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in more merchandise and stock her store. This way, she will be able to keep providing for her family and to have a greater stability.

loans.use: to buy basic staples for her store.

loans.name: Claudia Yanira

texts.es: Claudia de 39 años de edad, es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que es muy emprendedora. Ella vive junto a su padre y tres hijos que se dedican a estudiar. Para poder sostener su hogar, Claudia trabaja elaborando platillos típicos como: pastelitos, yuca frita, atoles y otros más, así mismo posee una tienda de productos perecederos en donde comercializa sodas, jugos, agua embotellada, granos básicos, huevos, jabones, desinfectantes, golosinas y otros más. El mayor deseo de Claudia es poder surtir su negocio, debido a que no cuenta con competencia en la zona, tiene varios clientes fijos, así mismo su venta de antojitos no tiene rival, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los platillos típicos y así mismo surtir su tienda.
texts.en: 39-year-old Claudia has very good personal references because she is a very entrepreneurial person.  She lives with her father and three children who are currently in school.  In order to support her household, Claudia works preparing traditional dishes such as 'pastelitos' (meat pastries), deep-fried cassava, 'atoles' (a corn-based drink), etc.  She also has a grocery store where she sells soda, juice, bottled water, basic grains, eggs, soap, disinfectant, candies, etc.  Claudia's greatest wish is to stock her businesses because neither of her businesses have any competition locally and she has a good number of regular customers. Claudia is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying ingredients for making her traditional dishes and to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing traditional dishes

loans.name: Behzod

texts.en:
Behzod is 31 years old and is married with two children. His wife, Nodira, is very kind and is a worker on a private farm. For the past two years, Behzod has worked at IMON International as casher. He is a hardworking and trusty employee who uses his salary to provide necessary things for his family. Behzod likes his job and works with pleasure, but is unable to save much money.  He dreams of having a good career and is studying at the Tajikistan State University to earn a second diploma. 

Behzod is requesting a 550 USD loan to pay his university tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 31ans, et père de 02 enfants de 09 et 07ans tous scolarisés, Dodji est revendeur. Il a pour femme une coiffeuse et exerce comme activité la vente des CD et des produits de quincailleries. Son activité se déroule dans une boutique et cela depuis 08ans. Parfois confronté aux problèmes de mévente, il se bat toujours pour apporter le meilleur de lui-même. Il est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui servira à acheter de la marchandise qu’il va revendre aux clients. Il s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et désire constituer plus d’épargne pour faire accroitre son activité tout en prenant soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dodji is a young 31-year-old man and a father of two children, who are seven and nine years old and go to school. His wife is a hair stylist. He is a retailer of CDs and hardware products. He sells his goods in a shop and has been doing this for eight years. 

Sometimes confronted with poor sales, he continues to strive for the best in himself.

He is on his fourth loan with WAGES and this loan will help him buy merchandise that he is going to resell to his customers. He procures this merchandise from the Grand Market of Lome. 

Dodji wants to save up some more money in order to expand his business while taking care of his family.

loans.use: to buy CDs and hardware products

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Greetings come to you from a team of able and dedicated teachers based in the eastern city of Koidu. These teachers are proud of their previous Kiva loan and are very grateful to all those who made it possible for them. With the aid of that loan, they were able to meet their immediate and most pressing financial challenges. 

Having successfully completed repayment of their loan, they have decided to apply for a second loan in the amount of 7,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones. This new loan will enable the members of this group to further meet unresolved challenges and tackle new ones. 

Featured leader Francis used his previous loan to buy building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house. He started the project but was unable to complete the house due to insufficient funds. He has asked for this new loan in order to buy building materials to continue the house building project he has begun.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is 27 years old and married with two daughters. He is from Gaza and operates a general store.

Ramadan is requesting a youth loan from Ryada to buy a refrigerator and install shelves in his store. He hopes that his loan will help to increase his sales and improve his income to provide his children with the best education he can afford.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install shelves in his store

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 43-year-old married woman who has five children. She is an energetic and ambitious woman who operates a retail store where she sells household items. Rehema's business is located in a suitable business area and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving her business. 

Rehema is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son premier cycle et elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Le responsable madame Anta est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles tous scolarisés.
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée d'une écharpe bleue et d'un foulard noir sur la tête.
Son nouveau crédit de 70,000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer un sac de riz, un fut d'huile de 20 litres, des condiments et des bouillons cubes destinés à la revente pour sa boutique.
Les bénéfices réalisés par cette activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group of 20 women joined the Banc Villageois on its first loan cycle and they joined forces through good social and professional relationships. The person in charge of the group, Anta, is a 40-year old married woman who is mother to five children: five boys and two girls, who are all at school. She is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a blue shawl and a black scarf on her head. Her new 70,000 FCFA loan will enable her to pay for a sack of rice, a 20-liter barrel of oil, condiments and stock cubes, all for resale in her shop. The profits she makes from this business allow her to provide for her children's food, schooling and health costs.
