loans.use: to buy food for her small business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Jennifer who is married with an 11-year-old child. She additionally takes care of her younger sister. Jennifer established her cassette business in 2011. She began her business because she wanted to fight against poverty and she works six days a week, 13 hours a day. Jennifer earns about 2,500,000 SLL each month. 

Jennifer is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to buy blank CD and DVDs. She hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 429,000 SLL. In the future, Jennifer plans to establish a film industry. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy blank CD and DVDs

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi vit avec sa conjointe et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Âgés de 06 et 03ans, ils vont tous à l’école. Mr Koffi quant à lui est ouvrier dans une société de la place. Pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille, il a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle il vend des denrées alimentaires. Sa femme est impliquée dans son activité et il est à troisième crédit à WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises (riz, huile végétale, tomate en boite, sucre, détergents…). A l’avenir, mr Koffi veut devenir un grossiste et pouvoir assurer les moindres besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi lives with his wife and their two children in Lome. His children are six and three years old and both go to school. As for Koffi, he works in a company in town. To make ends meet and to ensure the bright future for his family, he opened a shop where he sells foodstuffs. His wife is involved in this business. 

Koffi is on his third loan from WAGES. This loan will allow him to procure goods (rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatos, sugar, detergent...).

In the future, Koffi wants to become a wholesaler and to be able to ensure even his family's smallest needs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Madame Dédé est âgée de 31ans. Mariée à un revendeur, ils ont 02 enfants de 11 et 04ans scolarisés en charge. Standardiste dans un hôtel et en même temps revendeuse de bazins, elle exerce cette seconde activité à domicile. Les demandes des clients augmentent de jour en jour et n’arrivant pas à les satisfaire tous, elle se tourne vers WAGES pour faire un premier prêt afin d’acheter des marchandises (bazins) et répondre aux besoins de ses derniers. Elle souhaite avoir une famille épanouie et créer une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises. Elle a démarré en 2010.
texts.en: Dédé is 31 years old and married to a retailer. They have two children in their care, who are 11 years old and four years old respectively and both at school. She is a hotel receptionist and at the same time retails damask fabric, carrying out this secondary activity at home. Customer demand is increasing on a daily basis and, as she cannot satisfy this demand, she is turning to WAGES for a first loan so she can buy goods (damask) and respond to her customers' demand. She would like to see her family flourish and set up a shop to display her goods. She started this business in 2010.

loans.use: to buy damask

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le premier cycle du banc villageois, il regroupe 15 femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Kène est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, la main levée et habillée d'un grand boubou rose. Elle est âgée de 43 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 fille et 3 garçons.
Elle s'active dans l'embouche depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience. 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 200 000 francs cfa elle va acheter des moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de toute sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was set up during the Banc Villageois' first cycle and comprises 15 women from the same village who are united by good social and professional relations. The person in charge of the group, Kène, is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a large pink boubou. She is 43 years old, married and mother to four children: one girl and three boys. She has been active in the animal fattening business for a long time and has good experience. With her new loan of 200,000FCFA she is going to buy sheep which she will raise and resell at her town's weekly markets. The profits she makes will enable her to provide for all her family's food, schooling and health needs and boost her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es: Blanca de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, ambos son dos personas muy trabajadoras y muy responsables en todos sus proyectos, siempre con el deseo de ser mejores en la vida y salir adelante. Blanca trabaja comercializando ropa para mujeres y niños, la cual vende de forma ambulante en distintas colonias y barrios del departamento en que reside, Blanca siempre trata de adquirir ropa de buena calidad y precios accesibles ya que de esta forma se asegura mantener sus ganancias estables. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir, variando en colores, tallas y estilos. Con esto blanca contara con más productos para vender a buenos precios y de esto modo mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is 53 years old, and she lives with her husband.  Both of them are very hard working people, and they are very responsible in all of their endeavors.  They always have the desire to be better in life and to get ahead.

Blanca works selling clothes for women and children.  She sells in an itinerant manner in different suburbs and neighborhoods in the department in which she lives.  Blanca always tries to get good quality clothes at affordable prices.  This way she assures herself of maintaining stable income.

She is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can buy a greater quantity of garments in a variety of colors, sizes, and styles.  By doing so, Blanca will have more products to sell at good prices.  This way she will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 58 años de edad, vive juntos a sus dos hijas quienes trabajan y costean sus gastos personales y también le brindan ayuda para los gastos del hogar. Rosa es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que siempre se ha destacado por ser responsable y trabajadora. Rosa se gana la vida vendiendo productos medicinales de muy buena marca y de mucha confianza, los cuales los comercializa de forma ambulante y realizando visitas de casa en casa para dar a conocer los productos, así mismo comercializa perfumes, cosméticos y otros más. Ella cuenta con varios clientes fijos, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos medicinales y así también aumentar la cantidad de cosméticos que vende. Con esto Rosa tiene la ilusión de mejorar notablemente sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 and lives together with her two daughters who work and pay for their personal expenses and also support Rosa with the household expenses. Rosa is someone with good character references since she has always stood out for being responsible and hard working. 

Rosa makes a living selling medical products that are a well trusted, good brand. She sells them as a traveling vendor, making visits from house to house to let people know about the products. She also sells perfumes, cosmetics, and other products. She has several regular customers, which is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. She wants to invest in the purchase of a greater amount of medical products as well as increase the amount of cosmetics she sells. With this loan, Rosa hopes to notably increase her sales

loans.use: Purchase medical products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier.
Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles depuis longtemps.
La responsable madame Penda est une femme mariée âgée de 27 ans ayant à sa charge 4 enfants qui lui sont confiés, dont 2 garçons et 2 filles qui sont tous scolarisés.
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en bleu.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de fruits depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur.  
Son nouveau crédit de 110 000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des sacs d'oranges et d’arachides qu'elle va revendre au détail sur la table installée devant la porte de son domicile qui fait office de boutique.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes dans le but de pérenniser son activité de commerce.
texts.en: This group of 22 women joined the Banc Villageois on its first cycle. They have been united by good social and professional relationships for a long time. The person in charge of the group, Penda, is a 27-year old married woman who has four children who have been entrusted to her care: two boys and two girls, all at school. She is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and dressed in blue. She has had a fruit business for a long time and has good experience in this field. Her new loan of 110,000FCFA will enable her to buy sacks of oranges and groundnuts which she will sell on a retail basis on a table in front of the front door of her house which serves as a shop. The profits she makes will allow her to boost her savings so that she can maintain her business over the long term.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and oranges for a small business.

loans.name: Madlen Anne

texts.es: Madlen de 33 años de edad, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, vive únicamente junto a su hija de once años de edad quien depende por completo de ella. Madlen trabaja como secretaria lo que le permite contar con un trabaja estable, a pesar de esto ella busca diversas formas de poder darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija y que no les haga falta nada en el hogar, es por esto que también trabaja comercializando cosméticos como: perfumes, maquillaje, cremas y otros más, esto representa una gran ayuda para ella y su economía.  Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y así seguir adelante con su negocio, surtiendo la cantidad de productos de belleza que vende, lo que le servirá para vender más y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Madlen, age 33, is a responsible and hard-working woman who puts forth great effort in order to get ahead.  She lives only with her 11 year old daughter, who is completely dependent upon her.

Madlen works as a secretary, which allows her to have a stable job.  In spite of this, she looks for different ways to be able to give her little daughter the best and so that they will not lack anything in their home.  That is why she also works selling cosmetics like perfume, make-up, creams, and others.  This represents a big help for her and her financial situation.

That is the reason that she is requesting a loan from Integral.  This way she will get ahead with her business.  She will do this by stocking beauty products that she sells.  This will help her to sell more and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 02/12/2008, il est composé de 22 femmes issues du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Nogoye est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, la main levée, habillée d'un grand boubou bleu fleuri.
Elle est âgée de 51 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 5 garçons et 3 filles.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de manioc depuis bientôt 10 ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 75,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de manioc qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du petit marché de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was set up on 2nd December 2008 and is made up of 22 women all from the same village and united by good social and professional relationships. Nogoye is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a large blue flowery boubou. She is 51 years old, married and mother to eight children: five boys and three girls. She has been active in the cassava business for almost ten years and has good experience in this field. Her new loan of 75,000FCFA will enable her to buy sacks of cassava, which she will resell on a retail basis at the small market in her village. The profits she makes will allow her to pay her children's schooling costs and boost her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava, which she will resell in her local market

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 45 years old. He is married to Jackline and they have been blessed with eight children between four to 19 years of age. He runs a spare parts shop, and he has been in business for 10 years. Right now, his monthly income is KES 45,000.

William is borrowing of KES 50,000 to purchase motorbike and bicycle spare parts. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by adding more stock. 

This is his fourth loan, and he successfully paid his previous loans. William's hope and dream is to ensure his family is stable.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Brnakot village of Syunik region. She is married with a child and is engaged in agriculture. Gayane keeps livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 10 sheep and 10 chickens. She cultivates wheat and potatoes, as well as owns a plot of land where nut, apple and pear trees are grown. With the help of her husband, Gayane works hard to gather a good harvest and cover the family's basic needs.

Now Gayane needs some financial support for covering farming costs. She has applied for this loan to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and to cover fuel costs. This will enable her to feed the livestock. It is very important for Gayane and her husband to cover fuel costs and take the gathered harvest to the market.

Gayane hopes that the loan will help her to gather more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2009. Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods and a new refrigerator. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy goods and a new refrigerator

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka lives Mwambalasi, Kenya. She is 27 years old, lives in her parents’ house, and has a 14-year-old child.

For the past 4 years, Mwaka has been selling used charcoal and making local soap. She is busy working long hours on her business and this makes her proud. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and making a profit.

Mwaka is requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 KES to purchase charcoal for resale. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: James S.'s Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from this group of borrowers living and working in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone. 

These able and dedicated teachers have just concluded repaying their last Kiva loan and are very grateful to all Kiva lenders who made that loan possible for them. That loan created a huge impact in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use it to repair their houses. 

Having successfully finished repaying that loan, they have again reapplied for a new loan of 6,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to further meet unresolved or new challenges. 

Featured leader James is again going to use his share of the loan to buy house building materials in order to continue with the house building project he had begun with his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a family home.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is grateful for the previous loan and says it was helpful to her business. She is now requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Mevlud

texts.en:
Mevludi is 48 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District, West Georgia, with his wife and four children (three of them are under-aged). Mevludi leads his family's small-scale agricultural business. He runs a family-owned dairy farm, with two calves and two milk cows. Mevludi produces cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, he owns four pigs and sells piglets seasonally. The income is not enough to provide Mevludi and his family with adequate living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Mevludi has requested a loan from Credo to restart his seasonal business. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with fewer conditions to the country's rural poor for business start-ups and restart-ups. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of their low incomes, and they often do not have access to credit. With the loan, Mevludi will purchase chickens to restart a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them to sell them for a higher price. He hopes that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and restart his poultry farm

loans.name: Luz Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Luz y su esposo trabajan de sol a sol todos los días, el como soldador y ella con su negocio de pulpería vendiendo diferentes productos como ropa nueva, cosméticos, joyas y productos perecederos para ayudarse a obtener mas ingresos y cumplir con las necesidades de sus 3 hijos quienes cada día son mas grandes y los gastos son mayores. Con este treceavo credito quiere comprar granos básicos, cosméticos, productos lácteos, siempre a como ha venido invirtiendo en sus créditos anteriores para con el negocio, así ha salido adelante con la familia.
texts.en: Luz and her husband work from sunrise to sunset every day. He is a welder. She runs her small grocery, offering a variety of items like clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, and perishables to earn extra income to pay the ever-increasing expenses to support their three children. As with previous loans, she will use the funds from her 13th loan cycle to invest in her business and buy staples, cosmetics, and milk products so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy staples, cosmetics, and milk products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito Yoro. El tiene su propio negocio de zapatería, realiza trabajos de reparación y reconstrucción de calzado en general. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y lleva 20 años aproximadamente de tenerlo y ha sido su fuente de ingresos familiares. El préstamo que ha decidido tomar es para comprar materiales como pegamento, hilos y plantillas y es por 12,000 lempiras. Con esta inversión va mantener inventario de materiales para atender mejor a sus clientes.  Su meta es obtener ganancias para tener solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Don Victor is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the town of Negrito Yoro.

Victor has his own shoe shop where he repairs and rebuilds all types of footwear. The business is located in his home and he has been in this line of work for approximately 20 years since it provide a source of family income. The loan he decided to take is in the amount of 12,000 HNL and will be used to buy materials such as adhesive, thread, and insoles. With this investment, Victor will maintain his inventory of materials so that he can provide better service to his customers. His goal is to generate income so that he will be financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy adhesive, thread, insoles, and other supplies for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina has been involved in beekeeping for more than 15 years. She keeps 20 colonies of bees, cultivates barley, and grows nut and apple trees. Alina   lives with her husband in the village of Salvard in the Syunik region.

Alina sells honey and other agricultural products in the local market. Her income is very important to help cover basic costs. Due to her hard work and kindly attitude towards people, the honey Alina sells is in high demand among buyers.

Alina and her husband work hard to earn a sufficient income and improve their living conditions. Alina needs financial support to cover some operational costs. She has applied for this loan to pay for barley seeds, purchase fertilizer, and cover fuel costs. The loan is very important, as it would allow Alina to cultivate more barley and take the harvest to the market.

Alina waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, purchase fertilizer, and cover fuel costs

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Xiomara de 40 años ahora acompañada de su pareja quien es albañil, ella siempre cuida de sus hijos apoyada de su labor como vendedora y empacadora de productos químicos en una empresa privada, continua con la construcción de cuarto para su hija y necesita comprar bloques, hierro, cemento, arena, bloques por lo que solicita el credito para hacer de una sola vez esta construcción lo que su salario no le permite, pero si es posible gracias a los financiamiento.
texts.en: Doña Xiomara is 40 and lives with her spouse, who is a bricklayer. She has always taken care of her children through her job as a salesperson and packer in a private company that makes chemical products. She is still building a room for her daughter and needs to buy cement blocks, iron, cement, and sand. She is applying for a loan to buy the materials so that she can complete the construction, as she doesn't earn enough to do so. She is grateful for the funding.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Gantomor

texts.en: Mr. Gantomor is 36 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Ariuntsetseg, aged 34, is currently unemployed and stays home taking care of her family. His son Uuganbayar, aged 9, goes to the local primary school and his daughter Urangoo, aged 3, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been running his tire repair service on their plot of land since 2005. He has built close relationships with his customers and suppliers over the years. He is now requesting 500,000MNT to purchase spare parts for his equipment to run his tire repair business smoothly. He is a hardworking, responsible and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his equipment to run his tire repair business smoothly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 46 years old, and lives in Congo town in Montserrado County which has the largest city Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a security guard. They have five children between 15 to 25 years old that live at home and attend school. For the past 5 years she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for  her business

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio  vive junto a su pequeña familia en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de llantas de diferentes medidas desde hace ya varios años, eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias  y al mismo tiempo logra realizar el mejor trabajo, sabe que es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela, pues su producto es de primera calidad los precios son muy accesibles y además con un servicio excelente, sus clientes siempre quedan satisfechos; Marco es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes saber qué estás haciendo, te debe gustar lo que estás haciendo y creer en lo que estás haciendo, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas por mayor etc. Marco Tulio tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio lives with his family in their own home. For a number of years, he has sold tires of many sizes. This experience has helped him increase his earnings and do a better job. The business is profitable, and he has loyal clients because he offers high quality merchandise at affordable prices and excellent customer service, which keeps his customers satisfied.

Marco is honest, hardworking, and has many goals. He believes that to be successful you need to understand what you are doing. He dreams of growing his business and is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy wholesale tires. Marco Tulio has good credit references and impeccable standards. He is certain he can pay his debt while giving his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale tires.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de dos años. Se dedica a trabajar realizando los oficios domésticos a personas que solicitan sus servicios; ya que desde que nació su hija se separo de su compañero de vida y le ha tocado enfrentarse a los desafíos ella sola. Por lo que ha tenido que emigrar a la capital del país para ganar un poco más, su hija la ha dejado bajo el cuidado de su madre y Ana viaja todos los fines de semana para poderla ver y estar con ella, ya que hay una distancia de 95 kilómetros y se le dificulta viajar seguido. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, lamina para ponerle techo a la casa que esta construyendo, debido a que solo tiene construidas las paredes con sus propios ingresos. Sin el préstamo se le haría casi imposible, ponerle el techo a su casa, y lo que busca es vivir más cómoda y segura con su hija y mamá. En términos de unos tres años, sueña tener una casa repellada y con piso de cemento.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old and a single mother of a two-year-old daughter. She earns a living by performing household chores for people who request her services. Since her daughter was born, Ana and her partner have been separated, so she has had to tackle challenges by herself. She decided to move to the capital of the country so that she could earn a little bit more. Ana leaves her daughter in the care of her mother, but she travels every weekend so that she can be with her. The distance is 95 kilometers and she finds the frequent travel to be difficult.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood and metal sheets in order to install a roof on the house that she is building. Only the walls have been built using her own income. Without this loan, the task of installing a roof on her house would be almost impossible. Ana is looking to live more comfortably and securely with her daughter and mother. At the end of approximately three years, she dreams of having a whitewashed house with cement floors.

loans.use: to buy wood and metal sheets for installing a roof on her house.

loans.name: Regzedmaa

texts.en: Regzedmaa is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Jargalsaihan, is 45 years old. He is a herder, and he takes care of their livestock. Her daughters are Monhtsetseg, age 19 and a university student, and Mongonhundaga, age 11 and a student at the local secondary school. Regzedmaa lived in the countryside with her family, taking care of their livestock, for years. She moved to the provincial center to let her daughters to attend school. Regzedmaa has been working as saleswoman in the local market since moving into the province. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to start her own clothing business in the local market. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start her own clothing business in the local market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for planting and buy seedlings

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg is a 45-year-old female head of household who lives with her twin daughters and her mother in a small house in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays at home. Her twin daughters, Battuya and Battsetseg, 17, are seniors at the local secondary school. The borrower has been working as a dentist for years and has provided dental service in the countryside to herders by appointment  for some time. Now she is starting her own business and applying for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to start a small dental clinic to serve herders in the countryside. She is a hard-working, open-minded, and helpful woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start a small dental clinic to serve herders in the countryside.

loans.name: Sindilo

texts.en: Sindilo is 53 years old, married to David, and she has been blessed with four children, ages 19 to 29. She has been a tomato farmer in the Ntulele area for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000. With her fourth loan, of KES 40,000, from KADET LTD, she intends to acquire farm inputs to achieve better yields. She plans to use the anticipated profits to increase her farm acreage, and to build the family a permanent house. Her future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers , insecticides and seedlings, for her tomato farm.

loans.name: Nasuru

texts.en: Nasuru is 42 years old, married, and has eight children aged between 5 and 25 years old. She is a livestock keeper in Narok county and has been raising livestock for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 24,000. She is applying for her third loan, of KES 60,000, from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. She intends to use the anticipated profits to add more animals and pay school fees for her children. Her future dream is to prosper and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 45 years old, married, and supports a family of ten members, with children aged from 5 to 20. He is a tomato farmer in the Naroosura area, and this has been his occupation for the last 12 years. He receives a monthly income of KES 22,000. This is his second loan, of KES 50,000, from KADET, which he intends to use to pay to rent a tractor to plough his land, and to acquire farm inputs to achieve better yields. He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and buy inputs to achieve better yields on his tomato farm.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Mr. Batsaihan is 43 years old and lives with his parents in a Ger (a traditional Mongolian hut) in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His parents are retired and stay home. The borrower has been running a transportation service business since 2004 with a large vehicle. He is a well-experienced driver who is well-known in the area. He is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide taxi service in the city. His income is the family's only income.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide a taxi service in the city

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.  Nino’s elder son is a soldier, the younger is a student and her spouse is a miner earning a small monthly salary. Nino is a nurse at the local kindergarten. As their income is not enough for everyday expenses and food, Nino has decided to start a new business. 

She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected, due to her lack of experience in a new business and her low income. Experience is usually demanded by the local credit providers. 

Her loan request has been approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with easier conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit, Nino will purchase used clothing and sell it from her home among her neighbors. 

She will begin her entrepreneurial activity with a wide assortment of merchandise and a high sales volume. This will increase her income. She wants to develop her business further and reinvest the increased income in her business. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions for the family and Nino will be able to finance the education of her son in high school. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and start up a retail business

loans.name: Cyridion

texts.en:
Cyridion is 44 years old. He is a rice grower married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. His wife works together with him to grow rice. He wants this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production. He is planning to use the profits to buy a cow to provide milk for the entire family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Santos Jesus

texts.es: Santos Jesús  vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar con el pequeño negocio y ha adquirido experiencia valiosa que le permite agilizar la producción de tortillas, gracias al buen manejo de la venta siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, la comunidad donde vive es muy transitada y ya tiene mucha clientela, aunque sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todos la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad, a un precio accesible y sobre todo con el servicio mas rápido del lugar; Santos Jesús es una mujer activa, decidida y muy dedicada a su labor, desea salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto espera, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, etc. Santos Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Santos Jesús lives with her three children in their own home. She sells tortillas from a space in her house. She has run the small business for several years, garnering valuable experience in producing tortillas. She has managed sales well and increased her earnings. Her neighborhood is very busy, and she has many customers, most of them neighbors. Everyone prefers her tortillas because she offers a quality product at affordable prices and with the fastest service in  the area. 

Santos Jesús is energetic, determined, and dedicated to her work. She wants to get ahead and realize her dreams. She works hard every day because  she knows that it's the only way to achieve the success she so desires. Demand has increased in recent weeks, and she wants to take advantage of it to invest, but she lacks the necessary capital. 

She is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy wholesale corn and wood. Santos Jesús has good credit references and is very responsible. She promises to pay her debt and is certain she can give her family greater financial security.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and wood.

loans.name: Segundo Victor

texts.es:
SEGUNDO VICTOR tiene 52 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ARRAYAPAMBA se encuentra formada por 12 socios que son de la misma comunidad, a 25 minutos de la Oicina de la Cooperativa, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio. 

SEGUNDO VICTOR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos y ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger, herbicidas, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar semillas que le hace falta para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chillanes.

El sueño es tener una buena producción y mejorar la situación económica. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Segundo Victor is 52 years old, single, and has two children. He and his family live in the city of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “Arrayapamba”, which consists of 12 members who are from the same community. They live 25 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members engage in business activities such as farming, raising animals, and trade.

Segundo Victor is a farmer who grows beans and blackberries. He also raises and fattens pigs and cattle that he will eventually sell. Segundo is requesting a loan in order to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger (a brand of pesticide), herbicides, and urea. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy seeds that he lacks for farming. His purchases are conducted in the city of Chillanes. His dream is to achieve good production and improve his financial situation. The challenges he faces include dealing with pests that could ruin his crops.

In his free time, Segundo Victor enjoys playing sports and going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, pesticide, herbicides, and urea.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad is a 21-year-old master handyman and a proactive farmer. He lives with his parents and his brother. His father works as a controller at the electricity station and receives a salary of 180 AZN. Elshad runs a farm, where he has four cows and 15 sheep. He sells yogurt, milk and meat at the bazaar. Elshad is a very hard-working young man who works hard to cover his parents’ daily needs. As the farm is his main source of income, he would like to expand it. Elshad wants to make repairs at their house, and he has applied for this loan to purchase construction materials. This will enable him to improve his family's living conditions and to ensure a better life for his parents.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his parents’ house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 42, is married with six children between the ages of two and ten years old. His wife works with him in rice farming. He wants this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production. He wants to use the loan to reinvest in the agriculture sector.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last fifteen years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES15,000.

Margret was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000, to buy additional stock for her shop -- including items such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour -- to sell to her customers. 

Margret will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees and to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and flour

loans.name: Sonia Gloria

texts.es: Sonia gloria vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente;  es  mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Sonia Goloria buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia Gloria lives with her life partner and son. She owns a store in which she sells necessity products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and soap, among other things. She has had the business for a many years now, which has given her sales experience and has allowed her to always make the best profits. She is well known in her area and people recommend her store because it is always well stocked. She always has what people need at good prices and offers good quality products and excellent customer service. 

Sonia Gloria is a dedicated and hardworking woman. She is energetic and motivated to get ahead in life; she enjoys fighting for her dreams. She knows that if she works hard, she can achieve whatever she sets out to do and she will be successful in life.

As with any good salesperson, she would like to grow her business and invest more. For this reason she is requesting the loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks, soap, etc. Sonia Gloria has good payment references and impeccable morals. She is confident she can pay off her debt and is sure she will be able to bring economic stability to her household.

loans.use: buy basic grains, candies, bread, instant products, drinks and soaps

loans.name: Helene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il regroupe 28 femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
La responsable madame Bernadette, debout  la main levée à l’extrême droite de la photo habillée en blanc, est âgée de 53 ans mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 5 garçons et 4 filles tous à sa charge.
Bernadette s'active dans le commerce de fruits depuis longtemps. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 75000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des paniers de fruits divers et les revendre au détail au niveau de sa localité.
Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais scolaires sanitaires et alimentaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created from the first cycle of the local "banc villageois" loan group. It includes 28 women from the same village united by good social relationships.

The manager, Mrs. Bernadette, is seen standing with her hand raised at the extreme right of the picture and dressed in white. She is 53 years old and married with nine children: five boys and four girls all under her care.

Bernadette has long been active in the fruit trading business. She has good experience in this field. Her new credit loan of 75,000 FCFA will allow her to buy various baskets of fruit to be sold at retail prices in her locality.

The profits generated by her activities will enable her to support the school, health and food costs of her children.

loans.use: buy baskets of fruit for retail sales

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from this group of teachers in the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of able and dedicated teachers has just concluded repaying their last Kiva loan. They are very thankful to all Kiva lenders who made that loan possible. With their help, they were able to meet their financial challenges. They are now requesting a new loan of 10,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet unresolved or emerging financial issues.

This time, Sahr is the featured leader of the group. A 57-year-old married father of 10 children, 7 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools, Sahr has been in the profession for 40 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials such as cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials such as cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 28 years old and married with two children who are five and seven years old. She has been a rice farmer since 1999, and since then she has grown more tons of rice. Today she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production. She wants to use the profits to buy a machine to help with her rice production.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Sharaa

texts.en: Mrs. Sharaa is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger in Dundgovi Province of Mongolia. Her husband, Batchuluun, is disabled and stays home requiring constant care. Her sons, Zangibaatar, age 28, and Otgonbazar, age 20, work for local private companies. This borrower has been running a business selling religious articles from a rental counter at a local market since 2009. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 tugriks to purchase insulation material for her son's ger. She is a hardworking, strong and patient woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material for her son's ger

loans.name: Marlene Dinora

texts.es: Marlene Dinora vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de productos varios cosméticos, accesorios para dama, y además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende minutas, tener varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Marlene es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos, jarabes de sabores, hielo etc.. Marlene Dinora tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Marlene Dinora lives with her life partner in the house they own. She makes a living from selling various cosmetics and female accessories and, to supplement her household income, she sells shaved ice. She has been working in this business for a many years now, which has given her sales experience and has allowed her to always make good profits. Marlene Dinora is a travelling saleswoman and also works from home. She has a good client base because she always has what her clients need at good prices and offers good quality products and excellent customer service.

Marlene Dinora is an entrepreneur and very dedicated to her work. She always fights for what she wants and never thinks about giving up until she succeeds. 

During the past few months, demand has increased and she would like to invest more in her business, but she doesn't have the capital. For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy cosmetics, flavored syrups, ice, etc. Marlene Dinora has good payment references and is very responsible. She is confident that she can pay off her debt and is sure she can bring economic stability to her household.

loans.use: cosméticos, jarabes de sabores, hielo

loans.name: Angelica Marlem

texts.es: Angélica, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Con su esposo e hijos. Ella tiene 8 años de haber establecido su propia pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como ser: arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, harina, manteca, refrescos, churros, productos enlatados y otros abarrotes. Ha decidido por solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para surtir de productos como granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos y otros que necesite. Espera brindar un mejor servicio al cliente teniendo variedad de productos.  Tiene como plan de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Angélica is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Eight years ago, Angélica established her own grocery store where she sells food products such as rice, beans, corn, sugar, flour, lard, soft drinks, donuts, canned goods, and other items. She decided to request a loan of 12,000 HNL so that she can restock with products such as basic grains, dairy goods, sausages, and other things that are needed. Angélica hopes to provide better service to her customers by offering them a variety of products. She has plans of helping out with the household expenses and with her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy goods, sausages, and other products.

loans.name: Cidar German

texts.es:
CIDAR GERMAN tiene 51 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ARRAYAPAMBA se encuentra formada por 12 socios que son de la misma comunidad, a 25 minutos de la Oicina de la Cooperativa, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

CIDAR GERMAN  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, mora, además se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos y pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger, herbicidas, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar semillas. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chillanes. El sueño es tener salud para seguir viviendo y poder trabajar para poder tener un capital para el futuro.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear y disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Cidar German is 51 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

Cidar is a member of the Communal Bank “Arrayapamba”, which consists of 12 members who are from the same community. They live 25 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members engage in business activities such as farming, raising animals, and trade.

Cidar German is a farmer who grows beans and blackberries. He also raises and fattens pigs and chickens that he will eventually sell. Cidar is requesting a loan in order to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger (a brand of pesticide), herbicides, and urea. With the help of this loan, he will also be able to buy seeds. His purchases are conducted in the city of Chillanes. His dream is to be healthy so that he can continue living and working, which will enable him to have capital for the future. The challenges he faces include dealing with pests.

In his free time, Cidar German enjoys going out for walks and experiencing Carnival.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, pesticide, herbicides, and urea.

loans.name: Aska

texts.en: Aska is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 3,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Aska was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES to repair the water pump. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to help pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to repair the water pump

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Angel, de 35 años tiene una hija por quien trabaja a diario para brindarle lo mejor como padre, su esposa se encarga del orden del hogar no trabaja debido al alto índice de desempleo , Miguel trabajo vendiendo libros de manera ambulante ahora labora para una bodega de productos médicos como despachador, el tiene la necesidad de mejorar la apariencia de su casa por lo que empezara a construir cuartos, es por eso que solicita el credito para comprar materiales como bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, piedrines y pagara la mano de obra, así ira poco a poco mejorando su nivel de vida, tiene muchos deseos de superación por lo que continua estudiando, siendo este su ultimo año de la carrera en banca y finanzas.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 35 years old and has one daughter. He works hard everyday to offer her the best life. His wife takes care of the home but doesn't work due to the high unemployment rate. Miguel once made a living selling books as a travelling salesman, but now he works as a dispatcher for a medical product warehouse.

Miguel needs to improve the appearance of his home and so he will begin to build more rooms.He is requesting the loan for this reason, to buy building materials, such as blocks, cement, iron, sand and gravel, and so he can pay for the labor. In this way he will slowly improve his quality of life. He has a strong desire to succeed in life and as a result continues to study. He is in the final year of his banking and finances degree.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand and gravel and to pay labor.

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es: Aracelly es una joven luchadora, actualmente esta realizando sus estudios universitarios, pero por falta de dinero en su familia no ha podido comprar los utensilios necesarios para estudiar como los libros de texto y una computadora. Ella solicita un préstamo por seiscientos mil colones (600.000), lo cual le facilitará seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Aracelly is a determined young lady. She is currently completing her university studies but because her family doesn't have a lot of money, she has not been able to buy all of her school supplies, like text books and a computer. She is asking for a loan that she will use to continue her studies.

loans.use: purchase text books and a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise like educational toys.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La socia Martha nació en la ciudad del Saylla pero  vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que se dedica a la crianza de  animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.  Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en: The partner Martha was born in the city of Saylla but now she lives in the city of Cuzco. She is 29 years old and she has a boyfriend, though they are unmarried, and they have two children together. She is a hard worker and is also very responsible. She makes a living selling small animals likes guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this for 6 years and things are going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. She needs a loan to take advantage of an opportunity to purchase more small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: purchase small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres San Juaneras Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres San Juaneras, Es conformado por las señora Claudia  Ester de 42 años de edad originaria del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Claudia quien se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales ONMILIFE desde varios años, negocio con el cual ha ayudado en gran forma en la formación de sus dos hijos mayores quienes ahora ya se graduaron de su carrera de nivel medio, pero ella quiere seguir atendiendo a sus clientes en varias localidades de San Juan Sacatepéquez,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de producotos medicianles naturales(OMNILIFE).
texts.en:
Claudia Ester, 42, is a member of the Mujeres San Juaneras Duo. She is from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez. 

Claudia has made a living selling Omnilife medicinal products for several years. This business has helped her greatly in raising her children, who have now graduated from middle school. She would like to continue serving her clients in several areas of San Juan Sacatepéquez. She has applied for this loan to buy natural medicine products from Omnilife.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine products.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto, de 51 años es un hombre líder y responsable de su comunidad. Vive en compañía de su sobrino Edwin y su Hermana, con quienes habita en la casa que le heredó su madre.Desde niño vivió en el campo, aprendió a quererlo y valorarlo, por ese motivo consagró su vida en la siembra de diversos productos agrícolas. En sus terrenos siembra maíz, papa, alverja y habas, en extensas áreas verdes. En cada cosecha comercializa sus cosechas a la ciudad de Huancayo donde tiene muchos clientes, “soy autoridad en mi pueblo y viajo constantemente a la ciudad, aprovecho en negociar mis alimentos”, afirma. Además tiene 6 vacas lecheras, con su producción obtiene un ingreso diario que utiliza en otros gastos.  Él pertenece al grupo solidario “San juan” y este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, por lo cual promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser un hombre responsable.
Augusto, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles  en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Augusto, age 51, is a responsible man who is a leader in his community. He lives with his nephew Edwin and his sister. They share a house that he inherited from his mother. As a boy, Augusto spent his time in the fields where he learned to value and care for the land. For this reason, he has devoted his life to growing different agricultural products. On his land, he plants tracts of corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. The crops from each harvest are sold in the city of Huancayo where he has many customers. “I am an authority in my town and travel constantly to the city, so I take advantage of these opportunities to sell my products,” Augusto says. He also has six dairy cows and the milk that is produced provides daily income for other expenses.

Augusto is a member of the solidarity group named “San Juan” and this will be his first Kiva loan. He promises to be punctual with his payments since he was taught how to be a responsible individual. Augusto will invest 1,000 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer so that he can nourish his upcoming crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, 25 years old and single, has been a rice farmer for three years. With the loan, he wants to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production. With the profits from the business, he wants to buy a machine to help in the rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, meat, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Albeiro de 41 años de edad, ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a las labores del campo, actividad que le genera los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus sobrinos. Ama su trabajo por que está convencido que es una de las labores más significativas para el desarrollo de su país aunque muy pocos lo valores y en ocasiones los precios de venta sean muy bajos y no alcancen a remunerar la labor realizada. 
Con mil sueños por cumplir y llenos de motivos para levantarse diariamente a comenzar su faena, Albeiro desea poder incrementar su producción en la siembra de papa capira y fríjol, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el fin de sacar una excelente producción que le proporcione ganancias a fin de garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Albeiro, 41, has dedicated most of his life to farming, which generates an income to sustain his family and to pay for the education of his nieces and nephews. He loves his work because he is convinced that it is one of the most important jobs for the development of his country, even though there are few values and sometimes the sale prices are too low to compensate for his labor.

With many dreams to accomplish and full of motivation to get up every day and start working, Albeiro would like to increase his production of potatoes and beans in order to improve his income. He has applied for a loan to buy farm supplies, with the goal of achieving excellent production. This will provide him with an income to guarantee a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Ngone's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 23 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier et elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. 
La responsable madame Nogone est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 filles et 4 garçons.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de fruits depuis bientôt une dizaine d'années et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle est debout à droite de la photo la photo la main levée et habillée en boubou  marron.
Son nouveau crédit de 50,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des paniers d'oranges, de mandarines et de pastèques qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de la gare routière à la sortie de la ville. 
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront de payer les fournitures scolaires,les frais médicaux et alimentaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 23 women has been a member of the village lending group (banc villageois) since its first cycle. The women are united through good personal and business relations. The leader, Madame Ngone, is a 43 year old married women and mother of six children (2 girls and 4 boys).
She has been working in the fruit selling business for now nearly a dozen years and has good experience in this area.
She is standing up at the right of the photo, with her hand raised and dressed in a brown boubou. 
Her new loan of 50,000 XOF will allow her to buy baskets of oranges, mandarins, and watermelons that she is going to resell retail at the bus station at the city's edge.
The profits she makes in her business will allow her to pay for school fees, medical fees, and to feed her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit to develop her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 24-year-old single woman blessed with two children, operates a butchery and sells beverages in Kamulu, located in Tala. In business for the last two years, she earns an income of KES.40,000 per month.

Sarah has a good credit history with KADET LTD and is now applying for her third loan of KES.100,000 with which she plans to buy more meat to sell. She will use the extra profit to pay rent and buy additional meat. She hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of meat to sell

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 17 femmes,issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales, a été constitué lors du premier cycle premier du banc villageois
La responsable est madame Penda, debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée, est vêtue d'une robe orange recouverte d'une écharpe blanche.
Elle est marié, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 8 enfants dont 1 fille et 7 garçons.
Penda s'active dans l'embouche depuis bientôt 10 ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience.
Son nouveau crédit de 75,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charges les besoins alimentaires de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of seven women, all from the same village and united by good social relations, was created during the village lending group, or banc villageois', first loan cycle.
The leader is Madame Penda, standing up at the extreme right of the photo with her hand raised, is wearing an orange dress and a white scarf.
She is married, 48 years old and the mother of eight children (one girl and seven boys).
Penda has worked fattening livestock for nearly 10 years and is experience in this work.
Her new loan of 75,000XOF will allow her to buy sheep that she is going to raise and resell at the weekly markets in her area.
The profits realized will allow her to provide for her family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: María Susana  vive junto a su pequeña familia en casa propia, ella  posee una  venta de gas propano y tiene varios años con el negocio, eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, presta sus servicio desde un lugar que califico como muy bueno para realizar sus actividades, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo su trabajo es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; María es una mujer  activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere invertir en el producto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  gas propano por mayor etc. María Susana  tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Susana lives with her family in a house they own. She has a business selling propane gas and has had the business for a few years. This has given her a lot of experience that has allowed her to increase her earnings. She provides her service from a place I'd qualify as very good for her business. She has a lot of clients; people prefer her because all of her work is first-rate and at accessible prices, and also for the unparalleled service, always available to clients.

María is an active woman, dedicated to her work and determined to make a great effort every day to try to fulfill her dreams. She knows that only with constancy and love for her work will she be able to achieve that success.  The demand has increased in the last few weeks and she wants to invest in the product. She is therefore asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy propane gas wholesale, etc. 

María Susana has good payment references; she is very responsible and assures that she will be able to pay off the debt. A the same time, she has faith that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy propane gas

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier et elles sont unies par de bonne relations sociales et professionnelles.
Le responsable madame Ouléye est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans et mère de deux enfants dont 1 garçon de 13 ans et une fille de 11 ans.
Elle est assise au deuxième rang  à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en  grand boubou bleu noir. 
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour le pratiquer depuis dix ans.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 200,000 francs cfa elle va se payer des rouleaux de tissus pour les revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of women has been part of the village lending group (banc villageois) since its first cycle, and they are united by good social and professional relations.
The leader, Madame Oulèye, is a married woman, 39 years old, and mother of two children (one boy of 13 years and one girl of 11).
She is sitting down in the second row at the far right of the photo, with her hand raised and wearing a large blue and black boubou.
She has been active in the fabric selling business for a long time and has good experience in this area, which comes from having practiced this business for ten years.
With her new loan of 200,000 XOF, she is going to buy rolls of fabric to sell retail in her area. The profits realized through her business will allow her to take care of her children's food, school, and health needs and to strengthen her savings at the village lending group.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric to split and resell

loans.name: Yaye Oumou K's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 JUILLET 2011. Ce groupe est composé de 2 membres. Ces femmes sont en bonne entente.
Elle est à gauche de la photo, debout avec la main levée.
La responsable de ce groupe, Ndeye Coumba , est une femme mariée de 50ans, mère de 5 filles. Elle fait du commerce de poissons séchés, fumés et defruits de mer.  

Avec son prêt, elle espère développer son activité par l'acquisition de matériels frigorifiques.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle aidera son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The village lending group was opening on July 9, 2011. This group is made up of two members. They are women with a good relationship.
The leader is on the left of the photo, standing up with her hand raised.
The leader, Ndeye Couma, is a married woman, 50 years old, and mother of five girls. She does business selling dried and smoked fish and seafood.
With her loan she hopes to develop her business by buying a refrigerator.
With her profits, she will help her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to develop her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor, spray gun and tools.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra, tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace más de diez años. Su esposo es su gran compañía y su apoyo incondicional, ya que por problemas de salud no pudieron tener  hijos. En la actualidad labora desde su casa, realizando todo tipo de costuras.
Su mayor deseo es montar su propio taller y poder brindarle la oportunidad a otras personas de que se capaciten y generen sus propios ingresos. 
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que destinará en la compra de una máquina ojaladora, con el propósito de iniciar con su proyecto de vida y mejorar la calidad en su servicio. Espera que esta inversión le permita consolidar clientes y generar los ingresos necesarios para colaborarle a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en: Alexandra is 45 years old and has been making a living as a dressmaker for ten years.  Her husband is her great companion and provides unconditional support as, due to health problems, they could not have children.  She currently works from home, doing all types of sewing work.  Her biggest wish is to set up her own workshop and to be able to provide opportunities to others to learn skills and generate their own income.  Today she is looking for a loan that will be used to buy a sewing machine that can make buttonholes so that she can start her own life plans and improve the quality of service she offers.  She hopes this investment will allow her to strengthen her client base and generate the necessary income to support her husband with the costs of running the household.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine that makes buttonholes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers.

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il regroupe 29 femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
La responsable madame Mame Diarra est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 garçons et 1 fille.
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, la main levée et vêtue d'une robe rouge .
Elle s'active dans le commerce de légumes depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 25.000 francs cfa elle  va acheter des sacs de légumes pour les revendre en détail au niveau du petit marché de son village.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les fournitures et frais scolaires de ses enfants et d'épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created from the first cycle of the local "banc villageois" loan association. It consists of a group of 29 women from the same village united by social relationships.

The manager, Mrs. Mame Diarra, is a married woman aged 41 and a mother of three children: two boys and one girl. She is standing at the far right of the photo, raising her hand and wearing a red dress.

She has been active in the vegetable retail business for a long time and has good experience in this field. With her new credit loan of 25,000 FCFA she will buy bags of vegetables to resell at retail prices at her village's small market.

Profits from her activities will enable her  to manage school supplies and tuition fees for her children, and save at the "banc villageois".

loans.use: baskets of vegetables to sell at the village market

loans.name: Togtohjargal

texts.en: Togtohjargal is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a small house in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Her husband Zorigtbaatar is retired and stays at home. Her daughters are Uuganbayar, age 21 and a university student, and Undrahbayar, age 16 and a secondary school student. Togtohjargal has been running a tailoring service from her home since 1994. She is now requesting 2,400,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition and dormitory fee for the next semester. She is a hardworking, neat, and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition and dormitory fee

loans.name: Fabián De Jesús

texts.es:
Fabián de Jesús a sus 60 años de edad, asegura que su trabajo es una bendición y que a pesar de que sus ganancias no le permitan lujos, su felicidad es completa porque tiene una gran familia que permanece unida por el amor.
Gran parte de su vida laboró en el campo, Por circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad, se vio en la obligación de radicarse en la ciudad en donde trabajó en construcción. Al disminuir las ofertas de trabajo en este sector, Fabián decidió laborar como independiente, por lo cual comenzó a vender helados y paletas de manera ambulante, con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad.
