She is grateful for the opportunity and support she has received, and for the savings she has been able to build up.

Dora plans to use the support from this loan to purchase fruit from the central markets in El Alto for resale at her business in the smaller fairs and markets in her community. Dora is married with three children, and this job is her source of income for covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Tamutswa Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Leo from Masvingo. He is single with no children.  Leo runs a business that sells groceries, hardware and liqour. This business has been in operation for 17 years. He says the main challenge he faces is having enough money to buy more items. Leo has requested a loan of 1000 USD to buy groceries, hardware and liqour. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his profits; thereby, expanding his business and providing employment opportunities for the community. In the future, Leo wishes to grow his business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, hardware, and liqour

loans.name: Elshadai Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Anna from Mutare. She is married with five children, four attending school. Anna runs a clothing business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenges she faces are credit sales not perfoming well. Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kids wear and handbags) to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Anna plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rutendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Blantina from Masvingo. She is married with five children, three of which attend school.  

Blantina runs an agricultural business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for four years. She says that the main challenge she faces is running out of stock feed before selling all of her chickens, thereby incurring more costs. 

Blantina has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy chicks, stock feed, and diesel for the grinding mill. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Blantina plans to buy a truck to transport her chickens to various markets.

loans.use: to buy chicks, stock feed, and diesel for the grinding mill

loans.name: Trinity Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Precious from Mutare. She is married with four children, all attending school.  Precious runs a clothing business selling kids wear, handbags and shoes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge she faces is high custom duty at the border post. Precious has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kids wear, handbags and shoes) to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future Precious plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Besvim Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 58-year-old Betty from Mutare. She is married with six children. Betty runs a clothing business selling kidswear, suits, and footwear. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenges faced are high customs duties at the border post. Betty has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothing (kidswear, suits, and footwear) for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future Betty plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy stock and material for business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for their business

loans.name: Future Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Norah from Mutare. She is married with four children, one attending school.  Norah runs a retail business selling groceries and clothes. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are that the profit margin for groceries is very little and there is a high transport cost. Norah has requested a loan of $400 to purchase groceries and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Norah plans to improve her general family welfare.

loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes for resale

loans.name: Orleans Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Sevie from Mutare. She is married with three children, all attending school.  Sevie runs a retail business selling clothes, shoes, TVs and fridges. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are late payments from clients who buy on credit. Sevie has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothing, shoes, tvs and fridges to sell during tobacco sale season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Sevie plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: General Pando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERAL PANDO”  iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras deportivas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, tejidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras y deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando con su tía hace varios años,  posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Community Association "GENERAL PANDO," is in their fifteenth business cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) and with the Senkata Community Center. This group is made up of nine members and is managed by a board of directors on which Julia serves as president. The group members work in various industries, including: sewing sports clothing, food sales, beverage sales, weaving, etc.

The support from this loan will be used to benefit and strengthen the business endeavors of the entire group, including Julia, the group's president. Julia joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Julia runs a small business sewing and selling sports jerseys and jackets. She learned this trade and skill while working with her aunt for several years, and she subsequently decided to open her own workshop. When asked what she appreciates about Pro Mujer, Julia highlighted the financial and health training that the members receive.

With the support from this loan, Julia plans to purchase fabric for use in making her sports garments. She purchases fabrics in bulk from distributors in La Paz, and then uses those fabrics to fulfill client orders. This job has allowed her to generate income for covering household expenses and her family's needs. She is married with two children.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Friendly Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 47-year-old Tracy from Mutare. She is married with four children, one attending school.  Tracy runs a retail business selling clothes and kitchen utensils. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are high transportation costs and the duty at the border post. Tracy has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes and kitchen utensils for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her general family welfare. In the future, Tracy plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Josephine from Mutare. She is married with three children, all attending school.  Josephine runs a retail business selling electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are the high customs duty at the border post. Josephine has requested a loan of $400 to purchase electrical gadgets for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send children to better schools ands for them to acquire a better education. In the future, Josephine plans to own her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Kushinga Chikanga Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Mary from Mutare. She is married with four children. She also cares for two dependents. Mary runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are high transport costs. Mary has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Mary plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Alfred Muranda

texts.en:
Alfred, a father of four, has lived in Mukuru, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya, for twenty years. He is among the respected members of the community and owner of some rental houses in the informal settlement.

He is currently employed in one of the industries that surround the informal settlement and has set up a business for his wife. In this way, the family has a constant income every month.

The idea of a Fresh Life toilet was initially hatched by his wife, and he had to talk to an existing owner to make the decision to invest in two. He believes that a Fresh Life toilet will give his family supplemental income.

Alfred wants to grow his toilet business and give his family a decent life for as long as he can.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She is working hard to change her home structure. With her long-term partner, she decided to take a loan with Esperanza to continue improving their house.

Carmen has been taking loans with Esperanza International since three years ago. She is receiving her 7th loan, and this one is to build a water tank. She needs to store water because this is the only way they can have a reliable water source.

She is one of the members in the group called Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd) located in one of the rural villages in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. With this loan she will buy cement, sand, pipes and other materials for water uses. Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their houses while running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Carmen thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is from the Qarakert village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and two children and is involved in agriculture. 

Sara runs a farm, which currently includes 15 cows and 7 pigs. Sara also grows 100 apricot trees with great love and pleasure. She works hard to gather a good harvest, and she sells it in the local market. Sara's husband helps her to run a farm and sustain the family. 

Now Sara needs some financial support for the expansion of her farm. She has applied for this loan to pay for 4 bulls and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Sara to expand her farm and to earn a higher income. That income will enable Sara to cover her family’s basic needs and improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 4 bulls and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost seven years ago for a loan to expand her miscellaneous sales business. She joined the group "Esther" in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received loans to invest in her business.

Margarita is a mother with three children who she is raising by herself and with her long-term partner. She lives in a small slum community in San Pedro de Macoris. She is receiving her 14th loan from Esperanza. She is accessing this loan to make some changes to the structure of her home. She has been building her house little by little and this time the loan will be used to make different arrangements, especially to cover with cement and paint the walls, to put in some windows and zinc for her roof. Margarita will invest this loan by purchasing cement and other building materials.

Esperanza International is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while receiving business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy windows, concrete blocks, cement, etc.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik is from Armavir town. She is married with one daughter. Together with her husband, Sofik is involved in land cultivation. She cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and eggplant. Sofik sells gathered products in the market and earns an income which is hardly enough for covering the family's basic needs.

Now Sofik needs some financial support to expand her agricultural business. She has applied for this loan to purchase potatoes, cucumber seeds and to cover cultivation costs. This will enable her to cultivate more vegetables and gather more harvest. It is very important for Sofik to cover cultivation costs and save money for improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for potatoes, cucumber seeds and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Salvador Miguel

texts.es: Salvador de 39 años de edad habita junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. Es un hombre con diversas capacidades y cualidades que los vecinos, siempre con la disposición de ayudar a quien lo necesita Salvador es muy amable, con los que lo buscan, responsable con sus actividades y méritos diarios. Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor, es decir cultiva hortalizas como pepino, rábano y cilantro gracias a su manera de ser posee de clientes quienes lo buscan por precios accesibles y en esta ocasión necesita que INTEGRAL le brinde un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que los que tenia se le terminaron y para esta próxima cosecha necesita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Espera contar con la ayuda puesto que no tiene otros recursos para seguir alimentando a su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own home. He is a man with diverse abilities and qualities and is always willing to help his neighbors, being friendly when they look for him for whatever they need. He is responsible in his activities and daily production.

He is currently working in farming, that is to say that he grows vegetables such as cucumbers, radishes, and cilantro. Thanks to his personality his customers look for him because of his good prices and on this occasion he needs a loan from Integral in order to purchase agricultural supplies as what he had is depleted and for the next harvest he needs to buy: seed, fertilizer, compost, pesticide and more. He is hoping for help since he does not have other resources to continue feeding his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and more.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost three years ago for a loan to expand her clothing and accessories sales business. She joined the group El Señor es mi Pastor "God is my Shepherd" in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received loans to invest in her business.

Emilia is a hardworking woman with a child and living together with her long-term partner, who is also her child's father. She is receiving her 6th loan from Esperanza. She is accessing this loan to make some changes to the structure of her home. She has been building her house little by little and this time the loan will be used to finish walls and to have her roof done. She will invest this loan by purchasing cement and other building materials.

Esperanza International is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while receiving business loans and attending group meetings. Emilia thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, woods and zinc

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a proactive young farmer from Kornidzor village. He has been involved in agriculture for 7 years already. His livestock currently includes 4 cows, 15 sheep, 2 mother pigs, 6 little pigs and 5 chickens.

Agriculture helps Artak to sustain his family, so he would like to expand it. Artak has applied for this loan to purchase 3 cows. This will enable him to get more milk and milk products, the selling of which will give him high income.

Artak is married with two little sons and he does his best to cover his young family’s basic costs and ensure a better life for his little sons.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a welder/fabricator who lives in the Mombasa area of Kenya. He has been running the business for the last seventeen years. He employs one other person in the business. Evans is also married and has two school-going children. He mainly does vehicle repairs.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings to buy welding machines and other stock like soldering rods. He believes the income from such an investment will help provide a good form of education for his children.

loans.use: to buy welding machines and other stock like soldering rods

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two school-going children. He owns a barber service shop. Nicholas learnt about Milango through advertisements, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is power cuts and outages.

Nicholas is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to buy shaving machines and other items like methylated spirit. He believes that his business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan and also to help raise his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines and other items like methylated spirit.

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 6 DE AGOSTO está compuesto por once integrantes, nueve mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mariela tiene 33 años, tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 5 y 14 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   Panadera desde hace 8 años, su panadería se encuentra en la localidad de Rio Seco este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución el anterior crédito lo utilizo para su negocio, la Sra. Mariela utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, la Sra. Mariela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Mariela se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a todas sus compañeras de grupo ya que son personas que trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank 6 de Agosto is made up of eleven members, nine women and two men. 

The president of the bank is Mariela. She is 33 years old. She has two children who are 5 and 14 years old. She works making and selling bread. She has been a baker for 8 years. Her bakery is in the town of Rio Seco. 

This is her second loan cycle with the institution. She used the previous loan for her business. Mariela will use this loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast and butter to make bread. Her reason for asking for this loan is to buy wholesale supplies as it is cheaper to buy in quantity.

Mariela faces challenges in her business such as to have more customers in order to generate more income, and she is going to use the loan proceeds to give a better quality of life to her family. Mariela is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her and all the group members as they are people that work hard to bring up their families.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast and butter to make bread for her bakery buying at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad de 51 años de edad, habita junto a su familia en su hogar. Es un hombre muy responsable con las responsabilidades de su hogar, muy conocido por ser servicial amable, honesto y sincero, siempre con deseos de superacion y satisfaccion propia. Natividad se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultiva granos basicos y hortalizas vende lo que cosecha y es asi como sustenta las necesidades de su hogar. Natividad desea incrementar sus ventas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamo para comprar insumos agricolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, hervicidas entre otros. Con muchas ancias espera que la ayuda llegue a tiempo asi podra seguir brindando una buenas calidad de vida a el y su familia
texts.en:
Natividad is 51-years-old and he lives with his family in his home. He is a responsible man with the responsibilities of his home.  He is very well known for always being helpful, nice, honest and sincere. He always has the desire to get ahead and to be self-satisfied. 

Natividad works in agriculture. He harvests basic grains and vegetables. He sells what he harvests and this is the way that he sustains the needs of his household. 

Natividad wants to increase his sales and for this reason is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase agricultural supplies such as: seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides among other things. With a lot of worry, he hopes that the help comes in time to continue to provide the good quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies such as: seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, and other items

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José is a very responsible man who works joyfully and extremely hard to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and children, and has made a living for the past several years farming corn, beans and other staple grains.

In hopes of increasing his sales and growing his business, José is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase input items for tending his crops, including: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. Since he lacks the necessary capital to make this investment on his own, he is very grateful for this opportunity to continue with his farming operation and put food on the table for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and pesticides for tending his crops.

loans.name: Denises

texts.en:
Denises is one of Esperanza International's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza International almost three years ago for a loan to expand her fried food business. She joined the group "El Señor es mi Pastor" (God is my Shepherd) in one of the rural villages in San Pedro de Macoris, where she has received loans to invest in her business.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while receiving business loans and attending group meetings. 

Denises is a mother of three children and lives together with her long-term partner. She is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza. She is accessing this loan to make some changes to the structure of her home. She will invest this loan by purchasing cement, zinc, wood and other building materials. She will make some changes to her walls and to the roof. Denises thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc, wood and other building materials.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has been involved in agriculture for 10 years. He keeps livestock, which currently includes three cows, five mother pigs and two little pigs. Running a farm is the only source of income for Karen, so it is very important for him to expand it. 

Karen is a father of four children and is the only breadwinner of the family. So it is very difficult for him to save money for the expansion of his farm.

Karen has applied for this loan to purchase four calves, four mother pigs and forage for feeding the livestock. 
 
Karen is a very hardworking young farmer and does his best to ensure a better life for his lovely children.

loans.use: to pay for four calves, four mother pigs and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Mercedes Susana

texts.es:
Mercedes Susana de 29 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad. Originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Mercedes se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Ya que desde muy temprana edad tuvo que trabajar.
 En sus ratos libre le gusta pasar tiempo de calidad con sus hijos en actividades recreativas.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar laboratorio clínico.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa, desde hace cinco años, y está ubicada en unos de los mercados de la localidad. La rutina de trabajo de Mercedes es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, blusas, camisetas, short, faldas, bermudas, juegos de toallas, juegos de sabanas, ropa interior. Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes Susana is 29 years old, and is married with two young children. She is from León, which is located in the western region of the country. Mercedes is a very hardworking, responsible woman with lots of motivation for pursuing her life goals. She has had to work to make a living from a very young age.

In her free time, Mercedes likes to spend time playing with her kids. Unfortunately, since she did not come from a wealthy family, Mercedes was never able to pursue a degree at a university, but she would have liked to study clinical medicine. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and motivation for getting ahead in life, Mercedes was able to open up a clothing sales business five years ago. Her store is located in one of the central markets in her town, and she works ten hours there each day. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including: pants, shirts, blouses, tank tops, shorts, skirts, towels, sheets, underwear, etc. Mercedes is grateful for to Kiva lenders for this opportunity and for their support of hardworking people around the world in developing countries like Nicaragua who desire to work an honest job and make a living.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business, including: pants, shirts, blouses, tank tops, shorts, skirts, towels, sheets, underwear, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a salon which he has been operating for a year. He also owns a three-wheeler with which he provides transport in the area. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are debts and high rent. 

John is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like shampoos, hairpieces, lotions, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like shampoos, hairpieces, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a farmer in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is a farmer mainly planting potatoes, maize, beans, etc. He intends to invest in tea-tree farming. The oil from this plant is used to manufacture cosmetics. 

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the seasonal weather.

Benson is applying a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to cultivate land and buy seeds, including tea-tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to increase the acreage he has under tea-tree farming.

loans.use: to cultivate land and buy seeds, including tea-tree seedlings.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is involved in agriculture. He keeps livestock, which includes two cows and 11 sheep.
 
Gagik cultivates wheat and grows apricots, plums, cherries, pears and apples. He runs a farm with great love and pleasure and works hard to gather a good harvest and sustain his family. Gagik is married with two sons. 

As Gagik has no sufficient financial funds for the expansion of the farm, he has applied for this loan. The loan will help him to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. This will enable him to feed the livestock and cultivate more fruits and vegetables. 

It is very important for Gagik to gather high income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock, which includes seven cows, 15 sheep and 50 chickens. He gets milk which he uses in cheese production. He sells that cheese and gets a monthly income, which helps him to cover family's basic costs.

Bagrat is married with two sons, who jointly with their father are involved in agriculture. As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, Bagrat would like to expand his farm. He has applied for this loan to purchase 11 sheep. The loan is very important for Bagrat to increase his livestock and gather a high income. It is very important for him to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 11 sheep.

loans.name: Roosvelt Alberto

texts.es: Roosvelt de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia. Es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Roosvelt desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Cabe destacar que cuenta con un excelente record crediticio y esto lo hace resaltar un poco más. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Roosvelt is 39 years old and lives with his wife and children. He is a very responsible man who works joyfully and extremely hard to provide the best he can for his family. Roosvelt makes a living farming corn, beans and other staple grains.

In hopes of increasing his production and sales, Roosvelt visited INTEGRAL's offices to request this loan. He plans to use the support from the loan to purchase input items for tending his crops, including: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. He has an excellent credit history, and is grateful for this opportunity. Roosvelt hopes that this investment will provide the access to capital he currently lacks, and will help him to continue putting food on the table for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and pesticides for tending his crops.

loans.name: Pablo Esau

texts.es: Pablo de 38 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposa y su hijo. Es un hombre muy trabajador y se caracteriza por ser muy responsable en lo que a él le compete. Su mayor ilusión es brindarle un buen futuro a su pequeño y espera que cuando crezca le agradezca su amor y sacrificio. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos es así como él se gana la vida honradamente y en su hogar no falta el pan de cada día. Pablo desea comprar insumos básicos como: semillas, abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes. Espera y confía en Dios que su ayuda será escuchada y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
Pablo is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and son. He is a very hardworking, responsible man whose life goal is to give his son a bright future and love him deeply so that he will grow up to eventually realize all his father has given him. Pablo makes a living farming staple grains and working hard to put food on the table for his family.

With the support from this loan, Pablo plans to purchase seeds, manure, pesticides, fertilizers, etc. for tending his crops. He hopes and trusts in God for the good fortune to pay off this loan ahead of schedule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, pesticides and fertilizers for tending his crops.

loans.name: María Del  Carmen

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente Doña María pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, uno de los municipios participante del  programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  54 años de edad, docente, trabajadora del sistema educativo del estado, cuenta con ingreso bajo.

 Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposo y sus dos hijos  que son menores de edad. 
La señora María es la que tiene ingresos fijos en su familia ya que su esposo trabaja en ocasiones, cuando le ofrecen trabajo de albañilería. 

En estos momentos vio la necesidad de solicitar un financiamiento para instalar un  unidad  sanitaria económica que consiste en la instalación de un inodoro convencional con la construcción de sistema de tratamiento de efluentes (un tanque y un pozo de absorción), ya que actualmente ellos cuentan con letrinas,  siendo su  familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que incluye  a varios municipios del país, le permitirá realizar esa mejora en su casa que tanto lo necesita.

 Este proyecto es una oportunidad para muchas familias nicaragüense que vive esa realidad de no contar con acceso a sistemas sanitarios. Con solo sus ingresos que son bajos , se le hace imposible que logre instalar uno, pero con este programa tiene la oportunidad de accesar a un sistema mejorado para familias mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
This is the profile of the client Doña María. She is belongs to the county of Niquinohomo’s, one of the principle counties for the program of the creation of alliances to strengthen the local capacities for the reparation of Nicaragua. She is married and is 54-years-old. She is a teacher and worker in the educational system of the state through which she relies on low wages. 

Her nuclear family consists of her husband and her two children that are not adults. Maria is the one that has a fixed income in her family since her husband works on certain occasions when they offer him work as a mason. 

At this time she saw the need to get finances to install a inexpensive bathroom. This consists of a commercial grade toilet and the water treatment of plumbing (a reservoir tank and absorption well). They currently have a Porto potty. Her family is one of thousands that does not have access to sanitary facilities. With this project that includes several counties in the country, she would be allowed to make the improvement to her house that she needs so much. 

This project is an opportunity for many Nicaraguan that live the reality of not having access to a sanitation system. With her low income it is impossible to install one, but with this system they have the opportunity to set up an improved system for low income families. The current toilets cause sickness and contaminate the area, for this reason the idea was created to have a solution directed to the poorest people.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction of a shed and sanitary unit such as: sand, cement blocks, iron, stone, watercloset, and accessories

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer who lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He started his business with his own savings. Prior to starting up his business, Joseph had been a farmer planting vegetables, cereals and fruits. His area supplies the fruits needed in the Coastal area and is also a food basket for the region and beyond.

Joseph learnt about Milango from a friend who invited him to the group. He joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to better his business operations. The main challenges he faces are finding customers for his current business and seasonal weather.

Joseph is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizers. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His plan is to do large scale farming in five years' time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a business lady who lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She owns a green grocery, a business which supplies fruits and vegetables to the neighbors. She sells tomatoes, sugar, onions, etc., in this business.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high cost of transport while sourcing the goods. 

Christine is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some other retail stock. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her capital to grow the business and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some other retail stock.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
Lesbia María de 60 años de edad, soltera, originaria de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se destaca por sus comidas típicas como el quesillo y tiste. Lesbia se caracteriza por ser una persona con gran sentido de responsabilidad, lo cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores.
Gracias a  su espíritu de superación tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shapoo, sobre de café, sobre de salsa, arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico, pasta dental. Tiene 32 años en el negocio. La rutina de trabajo de Lesbia es trabajar unas 12 horas ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos comestible, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lesbia María  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lesbia María is 60 years old, single, originally from Nagarote, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Nagarote is known for its traditional food such as curd cheese and tiste (a beverage made from roasted corn, cocoa, annatto fruit, and sugar.) Lesbia is known to be a person with a great sense of responsibility, which has been demonstrated in her previous loans. 

Thanks to her desire to succeed she has as an economic activity a pulpería located at home. A pulpería is a small store that sells household products in small quantities such as shampoo, coffee packets, sauce packets, rice, beans, toilet paper and toothpaste.

She has been in business for 32 years. Her work schedule includes about 12 hours daily offering her products. The reason for a loan is to invest in working capital to supply her pulpería with household goods, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain higher earnings.

Lesbia María is grateful for the help that the Kiva loaners give to people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua providing the means to dignified work.

loans.use: to use as working capital to supply her grocery store with household products such as shampoo, coffee packets, sauce packets, rice, beans, toilet paper, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Elmer Vladimir

texts.es: Elmer de 35 años de edad reside junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que lo que a él más le ha importado en la vida es dar lo mejor para sus hijos y que estos se lo agradezcan el día de mañana. Es muy trabajador actualmente posee una pequeña cosecha donde cultiva arroz, frijol, maíz. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos Elmer desea ampliar más su cosechas, mejorarlas y que siempre sean las preferidas por los clientes  es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos básicos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, abonos u otros siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia espera contar con la ayuda necesaria y así seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Elmer is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children. He is a man with big dreams who works extremely hard to love and provide for his children, and he hopes that one day they will realize all he has sacrificed for them and given them. Elmer makes a living as a farmer and cultivates rice, beans and corn.

In hopes of improving his children's quality of life and strengthening his farming operation, Elmer is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, manure and other items for tending and and improving the quality of his crops. He hopes that this investment will help him to put food on the table and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and manure for tending his crops.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgen Purificada” del distrito de Cusco  de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Margarita es miembro del banco comunal, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 50 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona responsable y amble que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bocaditos.  Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Margarita en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo harina, dulces, mermeladas, manjar y otras cosas más. (Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión).

Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de; elaboración de  chompas,  venta de verduras, venta de cosméticos y otros ofrecen servicios profesionales. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends created a community bank called “Virgen Purificada” (Purified Virgin) of the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. This community bank is made up of various people that search every moment for the opportunity to get ahead and with their daily efforts create a better future for their children. 

Margarita is a member of the community bank. She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 50-years-old, she has a civil union from which she has a son. She is a responsible person and friendly that works in the creation and sale of snacks. She has been working for 20 years in this business and she is doing well. Margarita in this opportunity requires a loan to purchase more supplies such as: flour, sweets, jams, delicacies, and other things. 

The people that are in the bottom of the picture are the ones that arrived late to the meeting. The other members work in the following businesses: production of sweaters, sale of vegetables, sale of cosmetics, and others offer professional services.  

The partners in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and they promise to complete with the payment of different quotas in the established period.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, sweets, jams, delicacies, and other things.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 35 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y su hijo. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Además gracias a Dios posee un trabajo estable de en agro-ferretería. Cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar es préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas, para pago de una parcela para la cosecha.  Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Victor is 35 years old and lives in a house on his own property with his life partner and his son. He has worked in farming for many years. Also, thanks to God he has steady work in agricultural hardware.

He grows basic grains such as rice, beans and corn. Each year he repeats this activity. He is a hardworking person, responsible and enterprising. He works very hard to bring home the daily bread. This is why he has made the decision to ask for a loan through Integral in order to invest in the purchase of compost, fertilizer, pesticide and seeds, and to pay for a plot to harvest.

With a lot of confidence in God and in his work he hopes to have an abundant crop in order to have some to sell and some to eat. He hopes to fulfill his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and seed, and to pay for a plot of land to harvest.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 38 años de edad vive junto a sus padres. Es un hombre con grandes aspiraciones y deseos de superación, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador y todo hay sido inspirado por su familia. Siempre el su hogar jamás falta el pan de cada día y esto lo hace un gran hombre,  ejemplar y buen hijo. Carlos se dedica al cultivo de Maíz y Frijol. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado y no descansa con sus cosechas  es por eso que se acerca a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así comprar insumos necesarios como: Pesticidas, Insecticidas, Abonos para que sus cosechas no presenten problemas y él los pueda vender de manera que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día y sobre todo que siga siendo el hombre ejemplar que es en su casa.
texts.en: Carlos is 38 years old and lives with his parents. He is a man who aspires to a lot and really wants to get ahead. He is always described as a hard worker  and is always inspired by his family. This makes him a good man, a good example and a good son. Carlos grows corn and beans. He is a man who has always worked and he doesn't rest with his crops. That is why he has approached  INTEGRAL to ask for a loan to buy materials he needs such as: pesticides, insecticides and fertilizer, so that his crops won't have any problems and he will be able to sell them. This way his home won't lack its daily bread and above all he can still be a good example in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials he needs such as pesticides, insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo N° 1 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Es un grupo que está demostrando unión y ganas de salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. La Sra. Rosa. tiene una pequeña mercería y está muy contenta con las capacitaciones recibidas de la asesora, que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza. Ella cuenta que su mercería de a poco está creciendo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, zapatillas, artículos de bazar y demás insumos para poder surtir su mercería y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group names “Sagrada Familia”  (Sacred Family) is in the first cycle of the program “Comité de Mujeres” (Committee of Women), where all of them work and help each other to get ahead. This group has demonstrated a union and desire to get ahead. 

One of the members is Rosa, who in her last survey demonstrated that she was below the poverty line in the first level. Rosa has a small shop and is very happy with the trainings received from the adviser. They are somehow demanding and at the same time incentivize the women to fight for the ability to overcome poverty. 

She expects that her merchandise will slowly keep growing. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of garments, slippers, articles of a bazaar, and other supplies to be able to offer her merchandise and keep working.

loans.use: to purchase garments, slippers, articles of the bazaar, and other items

loans.name: Heylin Judith

texts.es:
Heylin Judith es nacido en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona  casada con  una persona bajo su cargo, su actividad es comerciante de venta de cosmético y articulo para el hogar y ofrece su producto a persona conocida al crédito  de pago quincenal.

Esta solicitando a Ceprodel un crédito para seguir mejorando su negocio en la compra de mas producto tales como perfume, licuadora, plancha, crema de mano y hacer otra inversiones como ropa de dama.

Doña Heylin Judith agradece  los financiamientos ya que ha podido salir aumentando su negocio, porque ahora tiene más cliente.
texts.en:
Heylin Judith was born in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is married to a person under her care. She is a cosmetics and household items retailer. She offers her products to people she knows on bi-weekly credit payment.

She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to continue improving her business by purchasing more products such as perfumes, blenders, irons, hand cream and to make other investments such as ladies' clothing.

Heylin Judith thanks the lenders as she has been able to increase her business because now she has more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta en el ciclo nº 7,  mantienen el grupo con un excelente comportamiento de pago .El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es seguir trabajando, fomentar el espiritu solidario y mantener la unidad y la disciplina  del grupo.
La sra. Fidelina es la Presidenta del grupo desde el inicio, ella orienta a sus compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos mediante la buena utilizacion del crédito, todas demuestran  voluntad y solidaridad en el grupo, estan conforme con la asistencia y asesoramiento  que le brinda el programa. La Sra. Fidelina es manicurista, y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenos servicios que gustan a sus clientas, y por eso es que solicitan de este crédito, para poder comprar esmaltes, quita esmaltes, limas, alicates, corta cutículas y  demás utensilios que pueda usar en su trabajo.  Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que les será a todas de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This committee is in its seventh cycle. The group has maintained an excellent payment record. The objective of each one of them is to continue working, promoting a spirit of solidarity and maintaining unity and orderliness within the group.

Fidelina has been president of the group since the beginning. She guides the members to fight for their objectives through the good use of loans. They all show willpower and group solidarity, and they are in harmony with the advice and consultation the program offers.

Fidelina is a manicurist. She has good customers, as she always does very good work which her clients like, and this is why she is asking for this loan, in order to be able to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, nail files, nail clippers to cut cuticles and other utensils that she can use in her work. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, and it is going to be helpful to everyone.

loans.use: o buy nail polish, nail polish remover, nail files, nail clippers to cut cuticles and other utensils that she can use in her work as a manicurist.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Frente Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres al Frente"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas  y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa, crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo persona.
La Sra. Blanca, una de las miembros, anhela que su grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, para llegar al nivel más alto que un comité puede alcanzar. Blanca, en su negocio se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, vinos, licores, energizantes, whiskys y demás y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y ayudando a su familia con los ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres al Frente" (Women to the front) originated from promotions that were done in the neighborhood.  All of the members are from the same area, know each other and are neighbors from the neighborhood. The objective of each of these women is to work, to promote the spirit of solidarity, to get to the highest level of the program, and to grow not only economically, but also as a person. 

Blanca , one of the members,  longs that her group gets stronger everyday to reach the highest level that the committee is able to achieve. In her business, Blanca works in the sale of drinks in general. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of drinks in general such as sodas, wines, liquors, energizers, whiskey and others.  Through this she will continue her sales and help her family with the income that she has.

loans.use: Comprar bebidas para la venta.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. Felomina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additonal varieties of goods to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, etc. Felomina has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of goods to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, soap, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Hannah has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Hannah has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ana Marta

texts.es: Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, ella vive junto a sus padres  y un hijo, su esposo reside en Guatemala en donde trabaja para poder enviarle una ayuda para el sostenimiento del hogar. Ana posee una venta de queso duro, y así mismo elabora y vende tortillas, con el fin de obtener más ganancias Ana viaja a Guatemala para poder comprar jeans a menores precios y comercializarlos en la zona que reside con vecinos, amigos y personas recomendadas.  Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar queso por mayor, así mismo maíz para elaborar tortillas y para invertir en la compra de más jeans, y así de este modo aumentar sus ganancias. Para Ana mejorar su negocio es de mucha importancia ya que de esta manera podrá darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard working person. She lives together with her parents and son. Her husband lives in Guatemala where he works to be able to send some help to be able to sustain the home. Ana works in the sale of hard cheese and the same way works in the sale of tortillas with the goal to make more money. Ana travels to Guatemala to be buy jeans at a cheaper price and sell them in the area where she lives to her neighbors, friends, and recommended people. 

Ana is requesting a loan to Integral with which she will count on the money needed to buy wholesale cheese and corn so she can create tortillas. She also wants to invest in the purchase of more jeans and this way increase her earnings. For Ana, improving her business is very important because this way she will be able to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, corn and jeans to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга занимается выращиванием овощей в селе Крынки. Она начала свое тепличное хозяйство еще 10 лет тому назад. На данный момент Ольга на 25 сотках земли выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы, картофель, капусту и перец. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 6 000 гривен понадобились Ольге для того, чтобы купить удобрения, семена, пленку и отремонтировать теплицу к сезону.
texts.en: Olga grows vegetables in the village of Krinky.  She started her greenhouses 10 years ago.  At the given moment, she has 25 acres of land dedicated to early and late cucumbers, potatoes, cabbage and peppers.  Additional funds in the amount of 6,000 UAH will allow Olga to buy fertilizer, seeds, plastic, as well as to help her make repairs in preparation for the season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, plastic and repairs in preparation for the season.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она занимается торговлей женской обувью и одеждой на выездных рынках области. Галина работает в этой сфере торговли уже 17 лет. Периодически она сталкивается с разными трудностями, а именно спадами торговли, изменениями курса доллара, но, тем не менее, это не останавливает ее и она продолжает стремиться и дальше развивать свой бизнес. 
Галине понадобился кредит в размере 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную обувь и одежду для реализации этой весной.
texts.en: Galina lives and works in Melitopol.  She sells women's shoes and clothing at regional markets.  This has been her profession for 17 years.  Periodically, she faces different challenges, namely downturns in sales volume and poor exchange rates against the dollar.  This doesn't stop her, however, and she continues to strive to further develop her business.  Galina needs a lone of 8,000 UAH in order to buy seasonal footwear and clothing for the coming spring.

loans.use: to buy seasonal shoes and clothing for spring.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a food cafe. She mostly sells cooked food to the residents around her; the area has a high population, mainly composed of those who work in the island and have limited time to prepare their own food.

Mwanaidi was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is asking for a loan of 85,850 Kenya shillings to buy more ingredients for making her dishes, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals. She looks forward to employing more people, once she receives the loan and improves/expands the operations of her current business.

Despite the high level of bad debts, Mwanaidi believes she can earn more profit, which she will apply to several purposes:  the education of her children, providing income and jobs to the people she will hire to help her, and also opening a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil, and cereals/grains.

loans.name: Emelisa

texts.en:
This is Emelisa, 42, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emelisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Emelisa hopes that her business will grow and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Davaasuren, age 45, has been running a metal ger appliances manufacturing business at their home since 1999. Her sons, Purevdavaa, age 21, and Nergui, age 20, are university students and her youngest son, Purevjav, age 3, goes to a local kindergarten. Mrs. Narantsetseg has been helping her husband run his metal shop and she sells the products manufactured at the local market. Both the borrower and her husband are hardworking and well-behaved people. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay for her sons' university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her sons' university tuition fees

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует на одном местном рынке женской одеждой. Торговое место арендует. Работает в этой сфере вот уже 15 лет. Имеет двоих дочерей, старается обеспечить их всем необходимым, улучшая быт семьи. 
За суммой в 20 000 гривен Ольга обратилась к КИВА для того, чтобы приобрести новую партию одежды на весну.
texts.en: Olga is a businesswoman from Melitopol.  She rents space at a local women's clothing market where she sells her goods.  This has been her profession for 15 years.  She strives to provide her two daughters with everything they need while at the same time, trying to improve their quality of life.  Olga has turned to Kiva for a loan of 20,000 UAH to buy a new inventory of spring clothing.

loans.use: to buy a new inventory of clothing for spring.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена замужем. У нее есть взрослые дети. Елена имеет собственный бизнес.
Елена занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 20 лет. Наиболее продаваемыми являются ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры, перец и баклажаны. Елена ответственная и целеустремленная.  
Елена просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 12000 гривен на закупку удобрений, семян, пленки и на строительство теплицы. Благодаря новой теплице доход ее семьи увеличиться.
texts.en: Elena is married and has children who are grown.  She has worked growing food in greenhouses for the last 20 years.  Her most popular products are early and late cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers and eggplants. Elena is responsible and goal-oriented.  She is asking for a loan of 12,000 UAH to buy fertilizers, seeds, and materials for her greenhouses.  New greenhouses will allow the family income to increase.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and material for greenhouses.

loans.name: Leyerlita

texts.en:
This is Leyerlita. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, thus generating more income. She has been in this business for five years now. She also runs an electronic loading station and buy-and-sell business for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leyerlita hopes to give her children a good life and education, and dreams that her businesses will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Tuvshinjargal, age 45, works as a driver for a mining company. Her sons, Altangerel, age 22, and Nemehbayar, age 18, are university students. The borrower has been running her clothing sales business at a rental counter of the local market since 2002. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to pay for her sons' university tuitions and dormitory fees in Ulaanbaatar City. She is a hardworking, modest, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' university tuitions and dormitory fees in Ulaanbaatar City

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана - предприниматель, торгует продуктами питания. Благодаря прошлому кредиту она купила холодильную камери и смогла расширить свой бизнес. В это раз Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит на ремонт квартиры. Она живет в многоэтажном доме, и когда у соседей сверху сломался водопровод, ее квартиру залило водой. Она планирует сделать ремонт в ванной комнате и кухне, исправить потолок и поменять обои.
texts.en: Svetlana is a businesswoman that sells beverages.  Thanks to her last loan, she purchased a refrigerator which allowed her to expand her business.  This time, Svetlana is asking for an loan to make repairs to her apartment.  She lives in an apartment building and when her neighbors living above her broke a water pipe, her apartment flooded.  She plans to make repairs to the bathroom, kitchen, fix the ceiling and change the wallpaper.

loans.use: make repairs to her apartment.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 49 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. Aida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 11 years.

Aida requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and shampoo.

Aida would like to save money, for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and shampoo.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
This is Balbina, 62, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, with the help of her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Balbina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat only home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Balbina hopes her business will expand and dreams that the time will come when she will no longer need to borrow money. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsevelmaa is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 5 children in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her daughters, Uranchimeg, age 25, Shirenchimeg, age 24, and Odonchimeg, age 22, work in various fields for a living. Her sons, Amarjargal, age 9, is a primary school student and Bilguuntogoldor, age 2, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been heading the family since her husband passed away; she has been running her butcher shop since 2006. Now she is starting a welding service at home by order and the butcher shop will be run by her older daughter. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders and sell it to local customers at her daughter's counter. She is a hardworking, strong, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders to sell to local customers at her daughter's counter

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old, married, and has one child, who is currently going to school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Alma requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to resell, like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee and canned goods.

Alma would like to save money, for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, like shampoo, groceries, milk, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old, married, and has eight children, three of whom are in school. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, a business she has been in for 10 years.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
This is Deogracia, 57, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Deogracia operates a tailoring business. She offers mainly curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing, like uniforms and such, are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. 

Deogracia hopes to give her children a good education and dreams to have more sewing machines. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Nordod

texts.en: Mrs. Nordod is 60 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lhamhuu, runs a taxi service business in town. Her sons, Battogs, age 21, is a senior student at university and Enh-Amgalan, age 10, goes to a local school. She has been running her general store business at a rental counter of the local market since 2002. She is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to pay for her son's university tuition and living expenses in the capital city. She is a hardworking, well-experienced, and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition and living expenses in the capital city

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 57, who is a resident of Batasan, Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Lorenzo and they have children.  She and her husband manage their household while also operating a business.  She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.  She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business.  She will use the loan to expand her product inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

Edna hopes to expand her business and dreams to have their own house.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages for her variety store.

loans.name: 040121 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
