Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net.  Hạnh is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 040121 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group.  Hạnh supports 3 dependents with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  In 2010, Hạnh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hạnh has successfully repaid 3 loans from this fund.  Her main hardship is the lack of capital.  In the future, Hạnh hopes to maintain a successful business and to have her children do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 57 años de edad, posee una venta de verduras y frutas, así también comercializa: leche, bebidas, juguetes plásticos,  golosinas, frituras de papa y de maíz, entre otros productos más. Juana siempre trata de tener surtido su negocio aunque sea con pocas unidades pero de productos variados. Ella vive junto a dos nietos y su compañero de vida junto a quien se encarga de sostener a sus pequeños nietos. Juana tiene ubicado su negocio sobre calle principal, lo que es muy positivo para ella ya que está a la vista de todas las personas que transitan la zona. Juana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar sus ganancias, ya que de esta manera podrá atender a más clientes, con lo que espera seguir brindándoles todo lo necesario a sus nietos.
texts.en: Juana is 57 years old.  She has a stand where she sells fruit and vegetables, as well as milk, drinks, plastic toys, candy, French fries and fried corn, among other items.  Juana always tries to have her business stocked even it is only with a few items but of various products.  She lives with her two grandchildren and her life partner.  Together they support their two small grandchildren.  Juana's business is located on a main street, which is very positive for her and it is in view of everyone who passes through the area.  Juana is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing more products in order to increase her earnings.  This will allow her to serve more customers, which she hopes will allow her to continue providing all the necessities for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, milk, candy and other items to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
This is Caroline, 42, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Caroline operates a lying-in clinic. She is a midwife by profession, and this is what she does for a living. She also earns income from her variety store, but she is more focused on her clinic. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in fees, every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan in the operation and renovation of her clinic. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. 

Caroline hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams that she will have her clinic fully renovated. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the operation and maintenance of her labor and delivery clinic.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 43 años de edad, trabaja muy duro elaborando tortas desde hace 8 años atrás. Él vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos que se dedican a estudiar. Miguel tiene ubicado su carretón a las afueras de un estadio, por lo que tiene muchos clientes fijos ya que a diario las personas asisten a este lugar para practicar diferentes deportes, así mismo esta es una zona de mucho transitan por lo que muchas de las personas que transitan por el lugar consumen también sus alimentos. Miguel desea hacer crecer su negocio elaborando más tortas y así mismo vendiendo bebidas como sodas, jugos y agua embotellada, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo mejorar su producción y venta de alimentos, comprando mayor cantidad de pan, vegetales, carne, jamón, aderezos, diferentes tipos de bebidas y otros más que le permitan mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias lo cual es primordial para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 43, has worked very hard making and selling tortas for the past eight years. He lives with his wife and two children, who are both in school. Miguel has a food cart located outside a stadium, which has earned him a lot of dedicated customers since people come to the stadium every day to play all kinds of sports. Furthermore, he's located in an area with a lot of foot traffic so a lot of people passing through stop by to eat something, as well. 

Miguel wants to grow his business, increasing the production of his torta stand while also starting to sell drinks like sodas, juices, and bottled water. That's why he's seeking a loan with INTEGRAL. The loan will permit him to improve his production and sales, buying larger quantities of bread, vegetables, meat, seasonings, various beverages, and other items that will allow him to greatly improve his earnings, which is a pre-request to providing for his home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making and selling tortas.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Karla se dedica a la compra de especias a granel para poder elaborar pequeñas bolsitas llenas de estas mismas para comercializar, así mismo vende fideos, harina y aderezos, su esposo le ayuda a comercializarlos y ambos los venden de forma ambulante, de este modo Karla se gana la vida y lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. Karla solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de especias, así mismo harina, aderezos y  bolsitas plásticas para colocar el producto. Lo que ella más desea es contar con más productos para vender y así poder percibir más ganancias. A pesar que la venta de especias es muy dura por las largas jornadas que deben trabajar movilizándose a pie de un lugar a otro, Karla está dispuesta a esforzarse aún más para poder contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar.
texts.en: Karla is a very hardworking woman who lives with her husband and their two children.  Karla buys spices in bulk so she can put together small packets of spices to sell.  She also sells fideo noodles, flour and dressings.  Her husband helps her sell the products, which they sell in the street.  Karla earns a living this way and supports her family daily.  Karla is requesting a loan to purchase greater quantities of spices, as well as flour, dressings, and plastic bags in which to put her products.  What she wants most it to have more products to sell so she can earn more.  Despite the fact that selling spices is difficult due to the long days they have to put in walking from place to place, Karla is willing to work even harder to be able to have everything she needs in her home.

loans.use: to purchase spices and dressings to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Raquel

texts.es: Sandra de 29 años de edad, es una joven madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos quienes dependen por completo de ella, Sandra vive en casa arrendada junto a su madre y también a una hermana. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas que elabora todos los días al mediodía y por las tardes, sus hijos le ayudan a repartirlas de casa en casa y ella también atiende en su casa de residencias. Sandra es muy esforzada y laboriosa y lo más que desea es poder brindarles una vida estable a sus hijos. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor para obtenerlo a precios más bajos y de esta manera obtenerle más ganancias a las tortillas. Este es un negocio muy estable ya que las personas consumen tortillas todos los días a toda hora.
texts.en: Sandra is 29 yeas old.  She is a young single mother of two small children who depend entirely on her.  Sandra lives in a rented home along with her mother and sister.  She sells tortillas which she makes every day at noon, and in the afternoons her children help her distribute them house to house.  She also sells them from her home.  Sandra is a very hard worker and what she wants the most is to be able to provide a stable life for her children.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which she will use to purchase corn wholesale in order to obtain it at lower prices and in this way make more money from the tortillas.  This is a very stable business because people eat tortillas every day at all hours.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y amorosa con su familia la cual está conformada por sus dos hijos y su esposo junto a quien comparten todos los gastos del hogar. Reina posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos alimenticios, bebidas y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, este es un negocio bastante estable, que cuenta con mucho clientes, razón principal por la que Reina desea invertir en la compra de más productos y de este modo tener una tienda muy surtida y más grande con la capacidad de atender a más personas de lo actual. Para lograr esto Reina solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con el dinero necesario para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Reina is 27 years old.  She is a very hardworking, responsible and loving person with her family, which is composed of two children and her husband, who shares all of the household expenses.  Reina has a shop where she sells food items, drinks,and staple items for the home.  This is a pretty stable business which has many customers. This is the main reason why Reina wants to invest in purchasing more products, so that she can have a well-stocked shop and attend to more customers than she currently can.  To achieve this, Reina is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she will have enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase staple items for sale.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 42 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house, on a plot of land. His wife works as a saleswoman at a superstore. Natsagdorj has been working as a weigh man and driver for a private business, which renders services in customs and transportation. Also, he transports goods from one place to another place using his micro van.

The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair work. During this season, the prices of building materials are at their lowest, so Natsagdorj wants to purchase building materials now, such as bricks, cement, wood planks, and metals. In addition to repairing the house, he wants to build a garage on his land, because during the winter time, the vehicle left outside becomes less efficient, using more fuel and emitting more smoke to the environment.

Concerning the above-mentioned reasons, he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to cover the costs of repairing the house and building a garage. As a result, his insulated and renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, and his newly-built garage will protect his micro van from strong storms and frosts, thus ensuring the efficient operation of the vehicle. All of those actions can contribute to efforts against air pollution, and will give the family the comfortable, warm house they need.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as bricks, cement and planks, for repairing the house and adding a garage

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 63 años de edad, ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, vive junto a dos hijos quienes trabajan y poseen una carrera universitaria gracias a los esfuerzos de Marta y quienes ahora le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Desde hace quince años que Marta trabaja en su propio negocio, comercializando productos de primera necesidad, como productos alimenticios, de limpieza para el hogar, golosinas entre otros. Actualmente Martha desea hacer crecer más su tienda por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de: huevos, sodas, jugos, pan francés y pan dulce, dulces, fritadas, chocolates, café y todo lo que las personas más solicitan, con esto Martha está muy segura que podrá obtener más ganancias y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha, age 63, has always been a very hardworking woman who's always pushed herself to improve her life. She lives with two of her children who work and both have a university education, thanks to Marta's efforts. Now, they help her out with the household expenses. For fifteen years, Martha has been self-employed, selling day-to-day basics like food items, cleaning products, sweets, etc.

Currently, Martha is hoping to grow her store further, which is why she's seeking a loan with INTEGRAL. With the loan, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of various items, including: eggs, sodas, juices, french bread, baked goods, candies, snack foods, coffee, and other goods that her customers are looking for. With this loan, Martha is quite confident that she will be able to achieve higher earnings and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy coffee, eggs, sweets, and other goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es: La señora Ana, vive en el barrio Santo Domingo madre soltera su esposo fallecio en la guerra,  sus hijos trabajan  por cuenta propia, pero siempre como toda una madre ejemplar esta al pendiente,  ella se ayuda con las ventas de bisuterías y ropa usada para pagar sus servicios básicos del hogar, solicita el préstamo para componer las puertas de su casa y el piso quedando aun pendientes reparar parte del techo pero sera poco a poco, comprara cemento, cerámica y puertas para vivir en una casa bonita y estable.
texts.en: Ana lives in the Santo Domingo neighborhood.  She is a single mother whose husband died in the war. Her children work, but like all good mothers, she still looks out for them.  She helps herself by selling costume jewelry and used clothing to pay for basic services in her home.  She is requesting a loan to fix the doors of her home and the floor.  She will still need to repair part of the roof, but this will happen little by little.  She will buy cement, ceramic tile and doors in order to live in an attractive and stable home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, ceramic tile, and doors.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Flordelisa works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Flordelisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials, like nets, wood and bamboo, for her fishing business.

Flordelisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, like nets, wood and bamboo, for her business

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan. His previous loan was a big help to his business. With the loan borrowed, he was able to start a new business as well. He also has a junk shop. His meat and fish business is still existing, but he is now more focused on his junk shop. 

He would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan. He will use the loan to buy more recyclable materials for his junk shop. He will also use the loan to buy hogs, for he is planning to enter the piggery business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Jonathan dreams that he will be successful in all his business endeavors. He is also hoping to have his own family. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: 02.06.05 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Nga is 24 years old, and she is married with one child. Nga has been involved in her business for four years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice cakes for resale.

In 2010, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

Nga is the group leader of the 02.06.05 Đông Hải Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.

loans.use: to purchase rice cakes for resale

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Munhbat is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife, Nyamsuren, has been in organic fruit and vegetables sales in the local market since 1999. His sons Bat-erdene, age 16, and Otgonbayar, age 15, and daughter, Buyanhishig, age 8, go to local schools. 

He has been helping his wife to run their organic fruits and vegetables business from a rental counter of a local market, and they have been growing organic vegetables in their plot of land for years now. 

He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase organic fruits and vegetables to sell to local customers. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking, open-minded and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase organic fruits and vegetables to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Mr. Myagmardorj is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger in Hovd Province of Mongolia. His wife, Yanjinlham, age 47, runs a small fruit and vegetable retail business in a local market. His daughter, Baasansuren, helps her mother to run their organic vegetable and fruit sales business in the market. His son, Byambadorj, works for a local company as an assistant worker. This borrower has been working as a fireman for a local company. He has retired and is now planning to start a taxi service business in town. Mr. Myagmardorj is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase a secondhand car to provide a taxi service business in town. He is a hardworking, positive and well experienced man.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car to provide a taxi service business in town

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres indígenas  donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 17 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aidé, quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno y a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo deben de ser constantes.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lencería y ropas usadas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Aty is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. They are indigenous women; they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey, as the 17 members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Aidé, who in her first survey demonstrated a level of poverty within level one. Through her effort and continual work she is improving her economic situation, but she is likewise aware that this work she is doing and effort she is making should be constant. 

Aidé asks for this loan to buy lingerie and used clothing, which will help her to materialize her business plan. This will in turn help her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – фермер-предприниматель из с.Крынки, Новая Каховка. Она уже 16 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 69 сотках земли выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры, редис, лук, баклажаны, малину, клубнику, перец, сахарную кукурузу и кабачки. 
В этот раз финансы понадобились Наталье для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы к новому сезону, закупить удобрения, семена на посев, приобрести пленку, дрова и сделать ремонт теплиц. Обновив и реконструировав теплицы, Наталья сможет получить доход от продажи ранних овощей и фруктов, заработав на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en: Natalya is a farmer and entrepreneur from the village of Krinky by Novaya Kakhovka. She has been growing greenhouse produce for 16 years. She has 6900 square meters [about two acres] of land and grows early and late varieties of cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes, onions, eggplants [aubergines], raspberries, strawberries, peppers, sweet corn and vegetable marrow. This time Natalya needs financing in order to prepare her greenhouses for the new season, stock up on fertilizers and seeds, buy film and firewood and renovate her greenhouses. After renovating and rebuilding her greenhouses, Natalya will be able to make a profit from selling early varieties of vegetables and fruits and earn funds for the needs of her family and business.

loans.use: to prepare her greenhouses for the new season, stock up on fertilizers and seeds, buy film and firewood as well as renovate her greenhouses.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación ,  trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2011,  se encuentran  en el 5to ciclo, y ya tienen un pequeño ahorro, gracias al esfuerzo de todas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Maria, ella tiene su despensa, está casada con el señor Raúl que trabaja de vendedor, tienen 2 hijos, por quienes ambos se esfuerzan para poder sacarlos adelante y darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
Cuenta la Sra. Maria que el crédito que solicita a la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de mas yerba, huevos, carnes, verduras, enlatados y demás para surtir mejor su despensa, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación emerged from contact with one of the members of the foundation. They have worked with the foundation since 2011, are in their 5th cycle, and already have a small savings, thanks to all their efforts.

One of the members of the group is Maria. She has a small grocery store and is married to Raul, who works as a salesman. They have 2 children, for whom they both strive in order to be able to get ahead and give their children everything that they weren't able to have.

Maria says that she will use the loan she is asking for from the foundation to buy more yerba mate, eggs, meat, vegetables, canned goods and other things to better stock up her pantry. She is very grateful, as thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her earnings and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy yerba mate, eggs, meat, vegetables, canned goods and other things.

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es: La señora Paula, ayuda incondicionalmente a sus tres hijos, en los gastos universitarios para que ellos se preparen y sean profesionales, sus ingresos como conserje son muy bajos, los que no le da para con los diferentes egresos que tiene, por eso opto por poner un negocio de nintendo, el credito es para comprar 3 televisores y 2 nintendos mas,  ya que la demanda es buena y tiene que aprovechar esta oportunidad, esperando que en un futuro pueda poner un comedor o pulpería, siempre contando con el apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Paula unconditionally helps her three children with their university expenses so that they are prepared and become professionals. Their incomes as janitors are very low, and it doesn't cover their various expenditures. This is why she decided to open a Nintendo shop. The loan is to buy three TVs and two more Nintendos, because demand is good and and she has to take advantage of this opportunity. She hopes in the future to start a canteen or a small grocery store, always having the support of financing.

loans.use: to buy three TVs and two Nintendos

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is a 54-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has five grown children. He has been engaged in the farming business for 25 years now. He also has a piggery as his second business. This is the source of his income. He usually earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month.
 
Apolinar is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and medicine. This will be used in his farming business. With the use of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for the productivity of his farm.

In the future, Apolinar hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and medicine.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a dried fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 26 years old and has two young children, ages 4 and 1. Clara works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Clara is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this loan, she will be able to sell more to the people in her place, thus augmenting her income and budget.

In the future, Clara has hopes of making her business a success and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en: Mrs. Ochir is 53 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lodonbaa, works at a local gas station. Her son, Serjhorloo, is a university student. The borrower has been running various kinds of retail businesses since 1995. She is now running a small retail business in a local market. The borrower has gained lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fees and to cover his living expenses in the capital city. She is a hard-working, positive, and modest woman.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fees and to cover his living expenses in the capital city

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Mrs. Lhagvajav is 44 years old and lives with her husband in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Amgalan, age 43, runs a transportation business in town. The borrower has been running a tailoring service since 1992 at home. She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to meet the demands of her customers. She is a hard-working, kind, and clever woman.

loans.use: To purchase some inventory to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been involved in the rice farming business with her husband for more than 25 years.

Cesaria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these, she will be able to improve their farm, and eventually, their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is a married man who is 42 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has three children. The eldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 7 years old. He has a food-selling business. He sells peanut butter, polvoron, and fresh buko (or coconut juice). He has been in this business for two years now. 
Arnulfo is requesting a loan to purchase additional items for his store. 

In the future, Arnulfo hopes to expand his business. He wants to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for his store

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is married and runs a business out of her house. She sells milk, salt, fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, books, rice, and bread. She opened her kiosk 1991 with her working capital of $80.00. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is making a good income from selling and she wants to buy more stock with the loan.

loans.use: To buy milk, salt, fish, noodles, coffee, sugar, Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, books, rice, and bread

loans.name: Dulambayar

texts.en: Dulambayar is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Altanhuyag, age 51, has a sight defect and has stayed home growing organic vegetables and doing a sales business since 1994. Her children Uuganbaatar, age 18, Altanbayar, age 14 and Osohbayar, age 8, study at local schools. She has been running an organic vegetable and fruit sales business in a local market for years. She is now requesting 2,350,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables and fruits to sell in her rental counter at a local market. She is a hardworking and talkative person.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables and fruits to sell in her rental counter at a local market

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a 55-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has three children — the eldest is 17 and the youngest is 11. She has engaged in farming business for 17 years now. She has a second business which is fishing. Her husband is a fisherman. These are the sources of her income. 

Emeliana is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, fish net, and gasoline. The fertilizer will be use for her farming business. She wants to buy the fish net and gasoline for her fishing business. With the help of this loan, she will be able to pay for the needs of her two businesses to be more productive and profitable.

In the future, Emeliana hopes to expand her businesses. She is also hoping to buy another boat.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fish net, and gasoline

loans.name: Judith Elizabeth

texts.es:
Judith una humilde joven, de 27 años de edad, con deseo de superación, se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 5 años de edad,  estudia su  tercer año de contabilidad. Inicio con capital propio con ayuda de su papa quien se dedicaba a vender perfumes de la línea de cosméticos, luego con el tiempo su  papa viaja a Costa Rica para buscar una mejor vida, fue allí que decidió dejarle el negocio a su hija para que ella lo administrara, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido sacar adelante, ya que con las ganancias que le genera su negocio ha podido continuar pagando sus estudios universitarios, una de las razones de Judith al mantener estable  su propio negocio es para evitar trabajarles a otras persona. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Judith solicita el financiamiento para comprar cosméticos como, perfumes, cremas, con el objetivo de comprar todos los cosméticos que aun no tiene en inventario, y a la misma vez hacer crecer su negocio cada día mas, para poder incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder tener su propia empresa de perfumes, para darles empleos a otras personas , una de sus metas próximas es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios, con la idea de tener mejor oportunidad y desarrollarse como una profesional.
texts.en:
Judith is a humble young woman. She is 27 years old and desires to get ahead in life. She is from Managua and works selling cosmetics. She is married, is the mother of a 5-year-old child, and is in her third year of accounting studies. She started her business with her own capital and with assistance from her father who also works selling perfumes from the line of cosmetics. Later, her father traveled to Costa Rica in search of a better life and from there decided to leave the business to his daughter so she could manage it. She was able to do this through tremendous effort and hard work, and in doing so she was able to earn enough to continue to pay for her university education. One of Judith's reasons for maintaining her own business was to avoid working for other people. Her husband helps her manage her business. 

Judith is requesting this loan in order to purchase cosmetic items such as perfumes and lotions in order to purchase all of the cosmetic items she does not currently have in stock, while also growing her business more each day by being able to increase her sales and earn more income. In the future she hopes to have her own perfume company and be able to provide employment for others. One of her next goals is to complete her university studies in order to have more opportunities and to develop more as a professional.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Narangerel runs a small butcher shop in a local market. Her child, Budjav, age 18, is a university student and Tsolmon, age 15, Badamhand, age 13, and Uranzaya, age 6, study at local schools. She has been running a butcher shop with her husband since 2000. She has been covering her family expenses from her business profits and her son has just enrolled in a university this year. Soon they will have two more university students and need to save more for their further education. She is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is a hardworking, communicative and honest woman.

Picture: Borrower is in the storage pit and posing in front of livestock pelts which she also sells to animal pelt retailers

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Ana Tisel

texts.es:
Ana de 26 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de seis y diez años.  Tras sufrir el abandono de su esposo, esta mujer tomó las obligaciones del hogar con el propósito de sacar su familia adelante. 
Con pocas oportunidades para emplearse debido a su bajo nivel educativo, optó por dedicarse a la venta de mercancía, actividad que le permite compartir con su familia y generar los ingresos suficientes para la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos.

En la actualidad, Ana tiene mucha clientela, la cual le solicita constantemente ropa y calzado, pedidos que no ha logrado satisfacer, debido a que no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar las compras a sus proveedores. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor deseo, más allá de alcanzar una estabilidad económica, es poder brindarles a sus hijos mejores concisiones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old. She is the mother and head of the family for two children ages six and ten. After being abandoned by her husband, she took over the obligations of managing the household in order to get her family ahead. With few opportunities for employment due to her lack of education, she opted to work as a merchandiser, which allows her to spend time with her family while also earning sufficient income to feed and educate her children.

Currently Ana has many customers who are constantly requesting clothing and footwear. She has not been able to fill all these orders due to the fact that she does not have sufficient funds to make the necessary purchases from her providers. For this reason she is requesting a loan with the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales. Her greatest hope--beyond even securing financial stability--is being able to provide a better condition of living for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela tiene 23 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de cinco años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Primero de Mayo,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ángela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar la carne, verduras,  y refrescos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frizer, la Sra. Ángela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Ángela es una persona joven con ganas de superación su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así brindar una mejor atención a su clientela.
texts.en: Ángela is 23 years old, she has a son who is 5 years old, and she works selling food from her storefront located in the Primero de Mayo district. This will be her first loan cycle with this institution. Ángela will use the loan to purchase a freezer which she can use to preserve food such as meets, vegetables, and drinks. She does not currently have the funds necessary to purchase the freezer on her own. Ángela faces challenges in her business which include expanding her customer base, but this will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. Ángela is a young person with the desire to get ahead in life, and her goal is to be able to open a restaurant and so be able to better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Uuganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his parents and two siblings in Ger, Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. His father is retired and stays home, while his mother works as a librarian at a local library. Uuganbaatar's siblings are university students. 

Uuganbaatar has been running a clothing sales business in a rental counter of a local market since last year. He has gained a lot of experience in the business and already has regular customers. He is now requesting a 3,300,000 MNT loan to pay his siblings' university tuition. He is a hard-working, energetic and goal-oriented person.

loans.use: to pay his siblings' university tuition fee

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.
Lydia has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Raymond's Group

texts.en:
Raymond is an eighty-one year old farmer and father of sixteen children. His wife is also a farmer. Regular periods of drought cause them to lose some or all of their crops.

Raymond decided to join the KOMAZA program as a tree farmer in order to reduce his poverty level. He hopes to use the proceeds from his tree farm to educate his children and invest in cattle.

Also pictured with the group of twelve are Nyevu, Elizabeth and Nzingo. They are all interested in the KOMAZA micro forestry program but were unable to join this planting season.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Ma. Mely

texts.en:
Ma. Mely is 43 years old and married with one child. Ma. Mely works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Mely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc..
Ma. Mely has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Ma. Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Mr. Odbayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in a ger in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Pagma, age 29, works at local construction company. His sons Enhtemujin, age 3 and Enhtemulen, age 1 go to a local kindergarten. Odbayar has been providing taxi services in town since 2010. He is now starting an auto repair service on their plot of land. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and tools to start his auto repair service. He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to start his auto repair service.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, fish, milk, coffee, sugar, salt and bread. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Filomena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, fish, milk, coffee, sugar, salt and bread for her kiosk.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.en: Farangiz is 22 years old. She is married but has no children at this time. She is a hardworking and industrious woman who lives with husband in an old and uncomfortable house. Her husband is a kind man but his income is small and that’s why Farangiz must find a source of income. She can sew a national slicker for men called a chapon. She is now going to organize her own business. She completed a course called ‘To get ahead’ through a women’s organization and learned skills about running a business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoin to buy fabrics and other necessary things for sewing chapons. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her new sewing business.

loans.name: Shida's Group

texts.en:
Shida is a twenty-eight year old farmer and mother of five children. She and her husband keep goats and poultry, and grow food crops. Their business is frequently affected by drought. Shida cannot find another job as she is illiterate.

Shida decided to become a KOMAZA tree farmer to generate income to educate her children and improve the family's standard of living. She also hopes the trees will improve the environment. With the money from harvesting her trees, Shida hopes she can send her children to college and invest in livestock.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia works hard to support her family. Nadia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Nadia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.
Nadia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Nadia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 42-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has two children. The youngest is 7 while the oldest is 18. She is engaged in a basket-weaving business. She makes baskets made of buri (native palm). She has been weaving baskets for six years. Her husband is a farmer.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy buri (native palm) and wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture). These  materials are very essential in basket weaving. In the future, Cecilia would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (native palm) and wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture).

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 63 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Nimfa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nimfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.
Nimfa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsagdorj is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Buren, age 36, runs cobbler service at home. His daughter Solongo, age 10, goes to a local primary school and son Gerelt-Od, age 4, goes to local kindergarten. Natsagdorj has been running a general store at a local market for years. He is now starting a butcher shop on a rental counter of the local market and is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders. He is a hardworking, neat and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of meat products from herders for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ella trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés, el cual elabora ella sola a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. Así mismo Ana también comercializa zapatos y sandalias, lo que le brinda una gran ayuda económica. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana lives with her husband and two children.  She is a very responsible woman who is always looking to improve her financial stability.  She works in her own bakery where she makes French bread.  She prepares it on her own in the small hours of the morning so she can sell it before breakfast, which along with dinnertime is when people eat it the most.  Ana also sells shoes and sandals, which is a great financial help to her.  She is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so she will have the help she needs to invest in flour, yeast, lard, tins, and everything she needs to increase her production.  This project for improving her bakery is very important to her because it will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bread

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. Charito is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Charito requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, eggs, canned goods and other groceries.

Charito has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Charito would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, eggs, canned goods and other groceries.
